`` <O> this <B> is <B> the <B> first <I> year <I> since <B> transportation <B> deregulation <I> in <B> 1980 <B> that <B> we <B> have <B> had <I> such <B> a <I> dramatic <I> and <I> broad-based <I> upturn <I> in <B> perceived <B> transportation <I> rates <I> , <O> '' <O> said <B> bernard <B> lalonde <I> , <O> a <B> transportation <I> logistics <I> professor <I> at <B> ohio <B> state <I> in <B> columbus <B> . <O>

not <B> everyone <I> believes <B> that <B> the <B> good <I> times <I> are <B> over <B> for <B> shippers <B> . <O>
`` <O> there <B> 's <B> still <B> a <B> lot <I> of <B> pressure <B> on <B> rates <B> in <B> both <B> rail <I> and <I> truck <I> , <O> '' <O> said <B> gerard <B> mccullough <I> , <O> lecturer <B> in <B> transportation <B> at <B> massachusetts <B> institute <I> of <B> technology <B> . <O>

the <B> carriers <I> were <B> competing <I> fiercely <B> for <B> market <B> share <I> . <O>

bob <B> stone <I> stewed <B> over <B> a <B> letter <I> from <B> his <B> manager <I> putting <B> him <B> on <B> probation <B> for <B> insubordination <B> . <O>
mr. <B> stone <I> thought <B> the <B> discipline <I> was <B> unfair <B> ; <O> he <B> believed <B> that <B> his <B> manager <I> wanted <B> to <I> get <I> rid <B> of <B> him <B> for <B> personal <B> reasons <I> . <O>
unable <B> to <B> persuade <I> the <B> manager <I> to <B> change <I> his <B> decision <I> , <O> he <B> went <B> to <B> a <B> `` <I> company <I> court <I> '' <O> for <B> a <B> hearing <I> . <O>
at <B> the <B> scheduled <I> time <I> , <O> mr. <B> stone <I> entered <B> a <B> conference <I> room <I> in <B> a <B> building <I> near <B> where <B> he <B> worked <B> . <O>
after <B> the <B> three <I> members <I> of <B> the <B> court <I> introduced <B> themselves <B> , <O> the <B> chairman <I> of <B> the <B> panel <I> said <B> : <O> `` <O> go <B> ahead <B> and <O> tell <B> us <B> what <B> happened <B> . <O>
we <B> may <B> ask <I> questions <B> as <B> you <B> go <B> along <B> , <O> or <O> we <B> may <B> wait <I> until <B> the <B> end <I> . <O> '' <O>
no <B> lawyers <I> or <I> tape <I> recorders <I> were <B> present <B> . <O>
the <B> only <I> extra <I> people <I> were <B> a <B> couple <I> of <B> personnel <B> specialists <I> , <O> one <B> of <B> whom <B> knew <B> mr. <B> stone <I> 's <B> case <I> intimately <B> and <O> would <B> help <I> fill <I> in <B> any <B> facts <I> needed <B> to <B> give <I> the <B> court <I> the <B> full <I> picture <I> . <O>
over <B> a <B> cup <I> of <B> coffee <B> , <O> mr. <B> stone <I> told <B> his <B> story <I> . <O>
he <B> talked <B> about <B> 20 <I> minutes <I> . <O>
when <B> he <B> was <B> through <B> , <O> the <B> court <I> members <I> asked <B> many <B> questions <I> , <O> then <B> the <B> chairman <I> said <B> they <B> would <B> like <I> to <I> hear <I> his <B> manager <I> 's <B> side <I> and <O> talk <B> to <B> witnesses <B> . <O>
the <B> chairman <I> promised <B> mr. <B> stone <I> a <B> decision <I> within <B> two <B> weeks <I> . <O>
bob <B> stone <I> is <B> a <B> fictional <I> name <I> , <O> but <O> the <B> incident <I> described <B> is <B> real <B> . <O>
it <B> happened <B> at <B> northrop <B> corp. <I> in <B> los <B> angeles <I> . <O>
the <B> court <I> is <B> called <I> the <B> management <I> appeals <I> committee <I> , <O> or <O> just <B> `` <I> mac <I> , <O> '' <O> and <O> it <B> is <B> likely <B> to <B> hear <I> a <B> couple <I> of <I> dozen <I> cases <I> a <B> year <I> . <O>
alter <B> some <B> details <I> of <B> this <B> example <I> and <O> it <B> could <B> be <I> taking <I> place <B> today <B> at <B> federal <B> express <I> in <B> memphis <B> , <O> the <B> defense <I> and <I> underseas <I> systems <I> divisions <I> of <B> honeywell <B> in <B> minneapolis <B> , <O> a <B> general <I> electric <I> plant <I> in <B> columbia <B> , <O> md. <B> , <O> or <O> a <B> number <I> of <B> other <B> companies <I> . <O>
these <B> firms <I> are <B> pioneers <B> in <B> a <B> significant <I> new <I> trend <I> in <B> the <B> corporate <I> world <I> : <O> the <B> rise <I> of <B> what <B> i <B> call <B> corporate <B> due <I> process <I> . <O>
although <B> corporate <B> due <I> process <I> is <B> practiced <I> today <B> in <B> few <B> companies <I> -- <O> perhaps <B> 40 <B> to <I> 60 <I> -- <O> it <B> is <B> one <B> of <B> the <B> fastest <I> developing <I> trends <I> in <B> industry <B> . <O>
in <B> the <B> coming <I> decade <I> a <B> majority <I> of <B> people-oriented <B> companies <I> are <B> likely <B> to <B> adopt <I> it <B> . <O>
corporate <B> due <I> process <I> appeals <B> to <B> management <B> for <B> a <B> variety <I> of <B> reasons <B> . <O>
it <B> reduces <B> lawsuits <B> from <B> disgruntled <B> employees <I> and <I> ex-employees <I> , <O> with <B> all <B> that <B> means <B> for <B> reduced <B> legal <I> costs <I> and <O> better <B> public <I> relations <I> . <O>
it <B> helps <B> to <I> keep <I> out <B> unions <B> . <O>
it <B> increases <B> employee <B> commitment <I> to <B> the <B> company <I> , <O> with <B> all <B> that <B> means <B> for <B> efficiency <B> and <O> quality <B> control <I> . <O>
what <B> must <O> your <B> management <I> team <I> do <B> to <B> establish <I> corporate <B> due <I> process <I> ? <O>
here <B> are <B> four <B> key <I> steps <I> : <O>
1 <B> . <O> make <B> sure <B> you <B> have <B> a <B> strong <I> personnel <I> department <I> . <O>
it <B> must <B> be <I> able <B> to <B> handle <I> most <B> of <B> the <B> complaints <I> that <B> can <B> not <I> be <I> solved <I> in <B> the <B> trenches <I> by <B> managers <B> and <O> their <B> subordinates <I> , <O> else <B> the <B> company <I> court <I> or <I> adjudicators <I> will <B> be <B> inundated <I> with <B> cases <B> . <O>
at <B> polaroid <B> , <O> the <B> personnel <I> policy <I> planning <I> committee <I> may <B> hear <I> only <B> about <I> 20 <I> cases <I> a <B> year <I> ; <O> the <B> rest <I> of <B> the <B> many <I> hundreds <I> of <B> complaints <B> are <B> resolved <I> at <B> earlier <B> stages <I> . <O>
at <B> twa <B> , <O> the <B> system <I> board <I> of <B> adjustment <B> hears <B> 50 <B> to <I> 75 <I> cases <I> a <B> year <I> , <O> only <B> a <I> fraction <I> of <B> the <B> complaints <I> brought <B> to <B> personnel <B> specialists <I> . <O>
at <B> citicorp <B> , <O> the <B> problem <I> review <I> board <I> may <B> hear <I> only <B> 12 <I> or <I> so <I> cases <I> because <B> of <I> personnel <B> 's <B> skill <I> in <B> complaint-resolution <B> . <O>
in <B> a <B> typical <I> year <I> , <O> up <B> to <I> 20 <I> % <I> of <B> the <B> work <I> force <I> goes <B> to <B> personnel <B> specialists <I> with <B> complaints <B> of <B> unfair <B> treatment <I> . <O>
in <B> a <B> large <I> company <I> that <B> means <B> many <B> hundreds <I> of <B> complaints <B> for <B> personnel <B> to <B> handle <I> . <O>
2 <B> . <O> formally <B> or <I> informally <I> , <O> train <B> all <B> your <I> managers <I> and <I> supervisors <I> in <B> the <B> company <I> 's <B> due-process <I> approach <I> . <O>
see <B> that <B> they <B> know <B> company <B> personnel <I> policy <I> backwards <B> and <I> forwards <I> , <O> for <O> it <B> is <B> the <B> `` <I> law <I> '' <O> governing <B> company <B> courts <I> and <I> adjudicators <I> . <O>
coach <B> them <B> in <B> handling <B> complaints <B> so <B> that <I> they <B> can <B> resolve <I> problems <B> immediately <B> . <O>
in <B> case <O> managers <B> and <O> personnel <B> specialists <I> are <B> unsuccessful <B> and <O> subordinates <B> take <B> their <B> complaints <I> to <B> a <B> company <I> court <I> or <I> adjudicator <I> , <O> teach <B> managers <B> to <B> accept <I> reversals <B> as <B> a <B> fact <I> of <B> business <B> life <I> , <O> for <O> in <B> a <B> good <I> due-process <I> system <I> they <B> are <B> bound <I> to <I> happen <I> . <O>
in <B> the <B> 15 <I> companies <I> i <B> studied <B> , <O> reversal <B> rates <I> range <B> on <B> the <B> average <I> from <B> 20 <B> % <I> to <B> 40 <B> % <I> . <O>
3 <B> . <O> decide <B> whether <O> you <B> want <B> a <B> panel <I> system <I> or <O> a <B> single <I> adjudicator <I> . <O>
a <B> panel <I> system <I> like <B> that <B> in <B> the <B> bob <I> stone <I> example <I> enjoys <B> such <B> advantages <I> as <B> high <B> credibility <I> and <O> , <O> for <B> the <B> panelists <I> , <O> mutual <B> support <I> . <O>
an <B> adjudicator <I> system <I> -- <O> that <B> is <I> , <O> an <B> investigator <I> who <B> acts <B> first <B> as <B> a <B> fact-finder <I> and <O> then <O> switches <B> hats <B> and <O> arbitrates <B> the <B> facts <I> -- <O> has <B> such <B> advantages <I> as <B> speed <B> , <O> flexibility <B> and <O> maximum <B> privacy <I> . <O>
international <B> business <I> machines <I> and <O> bank <B> of <B> america <B> are <B> among <B> the <B> companies <I> using <B> the <B> single-adjudicator <I> approach <I> . <O>
4 <B> . <O> make <B> your <B> due-process <I> system <I> visible <B> . <O>
it <B> wo <B> n't <I> do <I> any <B> good <I> for <B> anybody <B> unless <B> employees <B> know <B> about <B> it <B> . <O>
most <B> managements <I> hesitate <B> to <I> go <I> all <B> out <I> in <B> advertising <B> their <B> due-process <I> systems <I> for <B> fear <B> of <B> encouraging <B> cranks <B> and <O> chronic <B> soreheads <I> to <B> file <I> complaints <B> . <O>
on <B> the <B> other <I> hand <I> , <O> they <B> make <B> sure <B> at <B> a <B> minimum <I> that <B> their <B> systems <I> are <B> described <I> in <B> their <B> employee <I> handbooks <I> and <O> talked <B> up <B> by <B> personnel <B> specialists <I> . <O>
smith-kline <B> beecham <I> goes <B> further <B> and <O> sometimes <B> features <I> its <B> grievance <I> procedure <I> in <B> closed-circuit <B> tv <I> programs <I> . <O>
naturally <B> , <O> one <B> of <B> the <B> best <I> ways <I> to <B> guarantee <I> visibility <B> for <B> your <B> due-process <I> system <I> is <B> for <B> top <B> management <I> to <B> support <I> it <B> . <O>
at <B> ibm <B> , <O> the <B> company <I> 's <B> open <I> door <I> system <I> is <B> sometimes <B> the <B> subject <I> of <B> memorandums <B> from <B> the <B> chief <I> executive <I> . <O>
federal <B> express <I> goes <B> further <B> in <B> this <B> respect <I> than <B> any <B> company <I> i <B> know <B> of <B> with <B> both <B> frederick <B> smith <I> and <O> james <B> barksdale <I> , <O> chief <B> executive <I> and <O> chief <B> operating <I> officer <I> , <O> respectively <B> , <O> sitting <B> in <B> on <B> the <B> appeals <I> board <I> almost <B> every <I> tuesday <I> to <B> decide <I> cases <B> . <O>

'' <O> but <O> the <B> enterprises <I> still <B> in <B> state <B> hands <I> include <B> the <B> biggest <I> and <I> most <I> economically <I> powerful <I> ones <I> in <B> mexico <B> ; <O> indeed <B> , <O> they <B> virtually <B> constitute <B> the <B> economic <I> infrastructure <I> . <O>

the <B> experiment <I> was <B> stopped <I> briefly <B> to <B> change <I> an <B> instrument <I> . <O>
when <B> it <B> was <B> restarted <I> , <O> heat <B> output <I> `` <O> really <B> took <B> off <B> '' <O> and <O> produced <B> excess <B> heat <I> for <B> several <B> hours <I> before <B> dying <B> down <B> , <O> he <B> said <B> . <O>
typical <B> of <B> other <B> experiments <I> , <O> mr. <B> oriani <I> said <B> his <B> experiment <I> was <B> `` <O> very <B> erratic <I> . <O> '' <O>

the <B> excess <I> heat <I> was <B> 15 <B> % <I> to <I> 20 <I> % <I> more <B> than <B> the <B> energy <I> involved <B> in <B> the <B> electrolysis <I> of <B> water <B> . <O>

`` <O> there <B> is <B> a <B> reality <I> to <B> the <B> excess <I> energy <I> , <O> '' <O> he <B> said <B> . <O>
other <B> scientists <I> said <B> they <B> also <B> were <B> getting <I> sporadic <B> bursts <I> of <B> excess <B> heat <I> lasting <B> several <B> hours <I> at <B> a <B> time <I> . <O>
the <B> bursts <I> often <B> occur <B> , <O> they <B> said <B> , <O> after <O> they <B> `` <B> perturbed <I> '' <O> the <B> experiments <I> by <B> raising <B> or <I> lowering <I> the <B> amount <I> of <B> electric <B> current <I> being <B> applied <I> , <O> or <O> switching <B> the <B> current <I> off <B> and <I> on <I> . <O>
one <B> chemist <I> privately <B> suggested <B> this <B> hinted <B> that <B> some <B> `` <I> anomalous <I> '' <I> chemical <I> reactions <I> might <B> be <I> producing <I> the <B> heat <I> . <O>
one <B> reason <I> questions <B> surround <B> the <B> heat <I> experiments <I> is <B> that <B> they <B> involve <B> unusually <B> meticulous <I> measurements <I> . <O>
typically <B> , <O> the <B> input <I> energy <I> ranges <B> from <B> a <B> third <I> of <B> a <B> watt <I> to <B> one <B> watt <I> and <O> the <B> excess <I> energy <I> is <B> measured <I> in <B> tenths <B> of <B> a <B> watt <I> . <O>
one <B> exception <I> is <B> a <B> continuing <I> experiment <I> at <B> stanford <B> university <I> where <B> as <B> much <I> as <I> 10 <I> watts <I> of <B> energy <B> are <B> being <I> put <I> into <B> the <B> electrolytic <I> cells <I> . <O>
a <B> cell <I> filled <B> with <B> heavy <B> water <I> is <B> producing <I> 1.0 <B> to <I> 1.5 <I> watts <I> more <I> heat <I> than <B> an <B> identical <I> electrolytic <I> cell <I> filled <B> with <B> ordinary <B> water <I> next <B> to <B> it <B> , <O> reported <B> turgut <B> m. <I> gur <I> , <O> an <B> associate <I> of <B> materials <B> scientist <I> robert <I> a. <I> huggins <I> , <O> head <B> of <B> the <B> stanford <I> experimental <I> team <I> . <O>
one <B> of <B> the <B> few <I> hints <I> the <B> excess <I> heat <I> might <B> be <I> produced <I> by <B> fusion <B> came <B> from <B> brief <B> remarks <I> by <B> chemist <B> john <I> bockris <I> of <B> texas <B> a&m <I> university <I> . <O>

analysts <B> expect <B> the <B> prices <I> of <B> live <B> cattle <I> futures <I> contracts <I> to <B> rise <I> in <B> trading <B> today <B> in <B> the <B> wake <I> of <B> a <B> government <I> quarterly <I> census <I> that <B> found <B> fewer-than-expected <B> cattle <I> on <B> feedlots <B> . <O>
after <B> the <B> close <I> of <B> trading <B> friday <B> , <O> the <B> agriculture <I> department <I> reported <B> that <B> feedlots <B> in <B> the <B> 13 <I> biggest <I> ranch <I> states <I> held <B> 8.06 <B> million <I> cattle <I> on <B> oct. <B> 1 <I> , <O> down <B> 6 <B> % <I> from <B> that <B> date <I> a <B> year <I> earlier <B> . <O>

feedlots <B> fatten <B> young <B> cattle <I> for <B> slaughter <B> , <O> so <O> a <B> decline <I> signals <B> a <B> tightening <I> supply <I> of <B> beef <B> . <O>
the <B> government <I> reported <B> that <B> the <B> number <I> of <B> young <B> cattle <I> placed <B> on <B> feedlots <B> during <B> the <B> quarter <I> dropped <B> 5 <B> % <I> compared <B> with <B> the <B> year-earlier <I> quarter <I> . <O>

energy <B>

copper <B>

bernard <B> savaiko <I> , <O> senior <B> commodities <I> analyst <I> at <B> painewebber <B> inc. <I> , <O> said <B> that <B> when <B> traders <B> saw <B> the <B> market <I> was <B> n't <I> reacting <I> positively <B> to <B> the <B> forecasts <I> of <B> lower <B> lme <I> stocks <I> , <O> they <B> perceived <B> a <B> bearish <I> sign <I> . <O>

mr. <B> savaiko <I> said <B> he <B> sees <B> a <B> possibility <I> of <B> the <B> december <I> contract <I> dropping <B> to <B> $ <B> 1.05 <I> a <B> pound <I> . <O>
hewlett-packard <B> co. <I> will <B> announce <I> today <B> a <B> software <I> program <I> that <B> allows <B> computers <B> in <B> a <B> network <I> to <B> speed <I> up <B> computing <B> tasks <I> by <B> sending <B> the <B> tasks <I> to <B> each <B> other <I> . <O>
called <B> task <B> broker <I> , <O> the <B> program <I> acts <B> something <B> like <B> an <B> auctioneer <I> among <B> a <B> group <I> of <B> computers <B> wired <B> together <B> . <O>
if <B> a <B> machine <I> has <B> a <B> big <I> computing <I> task <I> , <O> task <B> broker <I> asks <B> other <B> computers <I> in <B> the <B> network <I> for <B> `` <O> bids <B> '' <O> on <B> the <B> job <I> . <O>
it <B> then <B> determines <B> which <B> machine <I> is <B> free <B> to <B> do <I> the <B> task <I> most <B> quickly <I> and <O> sends <B> the <B> task <I> to <B> that <B> machine <I> . <O>
hewlett-packard <B> claims <B> that <B> the <B> software <I> allows <B> a <B> network <I> to <B> run <I> three <B> times <I> as <I> many <I> tasks <I> as <B> conventional <B> networks <I> and <O> will <B> run <I> each <B> task <I> twice <B> as <I> fast <I> . <O>
the <B> new <I> hewlett-packard <I> program <I> , <O> said <B> analyst <B> john <I> mccarthy <I> at <B> forrester <B> research <I> inc. <I> , <O> a <B> computer-market <I> research <I> company <I> , <O> `` <O> is <B> a <B> key <I> building <I> block <I> as <B> people <B> move <B> to <B> this <B> new <I> model <I> of <B> distributed <B> processing <I> . <O> '' <O>
in <B> today <B> 's <B> computer <I> networks <I> , <O> some <B> machines <I> often <B> sit <B> idle <B> while <B> others <B> are <B> overtaxed <I> . <O>
with <B> the <B> hewlett-packard <I> program <I> , <O> he <B> said <B> , <O> `` <O> you <B> get <B> more <B> bang <I> for <B> the <B> buck <I> you <B> 've <B> spent <I> on <B> computers <B> . <O> '' <O>
the <B> program <I> , <O> which <B> will <B> be <I> shipped <I> in <B> january <B> 1990 <I> , <O> runs <B> on <B> the <B> unix <I> operating <I> system <I> . <O>
hewlett-packard <B> will <B> charge <I> $ <B> 5,000 <I> for <B> a <B> license <I> covering <B> 10 <B> users <I> . <O>
the <B> program <I> now <B> works <B> on <B> all <B> hewlett-packard <I> and <I> apollo <I> workstations <I> and <B> on <B> computers <B> made <B> by <B> multiflow <B> computer <I> inc. <I> of <B> branford <B> , <O> conn <B> . <O>
hewlett-packard <B> said <B> it <B> will <B> sell <I> versions <B> later <B> next <I> year <I> that <B> run <B> on <B> sun <B> microsystems <I> inc. <I> and <O> digital <B> equipment <I> corp. <I> machines <I> . <O>
the <B> task <I> broker <I> differs <B> from <B> other <B> programs <I> that <B> spread <B> computing <B> tasks <I> around <B> a <B> network <I> . <O>
a <B> previously <I> available <I> program <I> called <B> network <B> computing <I> system <I> , <O> developed <B> by <B> hewlett-packard <B> 's <B> apollo <I> division <I> , <O> for <B> instance <B> , <O> takes <B> a <B> task <I> and <O> splits <B> it <B> up <B> into <B> parts <B> , <O> divvying <B> up <B> those <B> parts <I> to <B> several <B> computers <I> in <B> a <B> network <I> for <B> simultaneous <B> processing <I> . <O>
but <O> programs <B> in <B> individual <B> computers <I> must <B> be <I> revised <I> in <B> order <O> to <B> work <I> with <B> that <B> system <I> . <O>
applications <B> wo <B> n't <I> have <I> to <I> be <I> rewritten <I> to <B> work <I> with <B> task <B> broker <I> , <O> hewlett-packard <B> said <B> , <O> and <O> the <B> user <I> of <B> a <B> computer <I> wo <B> n't <I> be <I> able <B> to <B> tell <I> that <B> another <B> machine <I> is <B> doing <I> the <B> work <I> . <O>
the <B> task <I> broker <I> `` <O> turns <B> that <B> network <I> into <B> -- <O> as <B> far <I> as <B> the <B> user <I> is <B> concerned <I> -- <O> one <B> giant <I> computer <I> , <O> '' <O> said <B> bill <B> kay <I> , <O> general <B> manager <I> of <B> hewlett-packard <B> 's <B> workstation <I> group <I> . <O>

usx <B> already <B> has <B> six <B> lines <I> in <B> existing <B> plants <I> producing <B> hot-dipped <B> galvanized <I> steel <I> , <O> but <O> this <B> marks <B> the <B> first <I> so-called <I> greenfield <I> plant <I> for <B> such <B> production <I> . <O>

the <B> company <I> said <B> it <B> does <B> n't <I> expect <I> the <B> new <I> line <I> 's <B> capacity <I> to <B> adversely <I> affect <I> the <B> company <I> 's <B> existing <I> hot-dipped <I> galvanizing <I> lines <I> . <O>
steelmakers <B> have <B> also <I> been <I> adding <I> capacity <B> of <B> so-called <B> electrogalvanized <I> steel <I> , <O> which <B> is <B> another <B> way <I> to <B> make <I> coated <B> corrosion-resistant <I> steel <I> . <O>
one <B> of <B> the <B> advantages <I> of <B> the <B> hot-dipped <I> process <I> is <B> that <B> it <B> allows <B> the <B> steel <I> to <B> be <I> covered <I> with <B> a <B> thicker <I> coat <I> of <B> zinc <B> more <B> quickly <I> . <O>
once <O> you <B> make <B> up <B> your <B> mind <I> about <B> an <B> investment <I> , <O> the <B> rest <I> is <B> easy <B> , <O> right <B> ? <O>
you <B> just <B> call <B> your <B> broker <I> and <O> say <B> `` <O> buy <B> '' <I> or <I> `` <I> sell <I> . <O> '' <O>
dream <B> on <B> . <O>
there <B> are <B> all <B> sorts <I> of <B> ways <B> to <B> give <I> buy <B> and <I> sell <I> instructions <I> to <B> a <B> broker <I> -- <O> and <O> just <B> as <I> many <I> ways <I> to <B> get <I> burned <I> if <B> you <B> do <B> n't <I> know <I> what <B> you <B> 're <B> doing <I> . <O>
so <O> here <B> 's <B> a <B> rundown <I> of <B> the <B> most <I> common <I> types <I> of <B> market <B> orders <I> permitted <B> by <B> the <B> stock <I> and <I> commodity <I> exchanges <I> . <O>
two <B> things <I> to <B> keep <I> in <B> mind <B> : <O> not <B> all <I> exchanges <I> accept <B> every <B> type <I> of <B> order <B> . <O>
and <O> even <B> when <B> a <B> specific <I> order <I> is <B> acceptable <B> to <B> an <B> exchange <I> , <O> a <B> brokerage <I> firm <I> can <B> refuse <I> to <I> enter <I> it <B> for <B> a <B> customer <I> . <O>
market <B> order <I> : <O> this <B> is <B> probably <B> the <B> most <I> widely <I> used <I> order <I> -- <O> and <O> the <B> one <I> most <B> open <I> to <B> abuse <B> by <B> unscrupulous <B> floor <I> brokers <I> , <O> since <B> it <B> imposes <B> no <B> price <I> restrictions <I> . <O>
with <B> a <B> market <I> order <I> , <O> an <B> investor <I> tells <B> a <B> broker <I> to <B> buy <I> or <I> sell <I> `` <O> at <B> the <B> market <I> . <O> '' <O>
it <B> 's <B> like <B> saying <B> , <O> `` <O> get <B> me <B> in <B> now <B> '' <O> or <O> `` <O> get <B> me <B> out <B> now <B> . <O> '' <O>
for <B> example <B> , <O> if <B> wheat <B> is <B> being <I> offered <I> at <B> $ <B> 4.065 <I> and <O> bid <B> at <B> $ <B> 4.060 <I> , <O> a <B> market <I> order <I> to <B> buy <I> would <B> be <I> filled <I> at <B> the <B> higher <I> price <I> and <O> a <B> market <I> order <I> to <B> sell <I> at <B> the <B> lower <I> price <I> . <O>
a <B> recent <I> indictment <I> alleges <B> that <B> some <B> floor <I> brokers <I> at <B> the <B> two <I> largest <I> chicago <I> commodity <I> exchanges <I> used <B> market <B> orders <I> to <B> fill <I> customers <B> ' <B> orders <I> at <B> unfavorable <B> prices <I> by <B> arranging <B> trades <B> with <B> fellow <B> brokers <I> . <O>
profits <B> realized <B> from <B> these <B> trades <I> would <B> then <I> be <I> shared <I> by <B> the <B> conspiring <I> brokers <I> . <O>
limit <B> order <I> : <O> limit <B> orders <I> are <B> used <I> when <B> investors <B> want <B> to <I> restrict <I> the <B> amount <I> they <B> will <B> receive <I> or <I> pay <I> for <B> an <B> investment <I> . <O>
investors <B> do <B> this <B> by <B> specifying <B> a <B> minimum <I> price <I> at <B> which <B> the <B> investment <I> may <B> be <I> sold <I> or <O> the <B> maximum <I> price <I> that <B> may <B> be <I> paid <I> for <B> it <B> . <O>
suppose <B> an <B> investor <I> wants <B> to <I> sell <I> a <B> stock <I> , <O> but <O> not <O> for <B> less <B> than <I> $ <I> 55 <I> . <O>
a <B> limit <I> order <I> to <B> sell <I> could <B> be <I> entered <I> at <B> that <B> price <I> . <O>
one <B> risk <I> : <O> investors <B> may <B> regret <I> the <B> restriction <I> if <B> the <B> stock <I> reaches <B> 54 <B> and <O> then <O> falls <B> . <O>
unless <B> the <B> market <I> goes <B> at <B> least <I> one <I> tick <I> -lrb- <O> the <B> smallest <I> price <I> increment <I> permitted <B> -rrb- <O> beyond <B> the <B> limit <I> price <I> , <O> investors <B> are <B> n't <I> assured <I> of <B> having <B> their <B> orders <I> filled <B> because <B> there <B> may <B> not <I> be <I> sufficient <B> trading <I> volume <I> to <B> permit <I> filling <I> it <B> at <B> the <B> specified <I> price <I> . <O>
stop <B> order <I> : <O> stop <B> orders <I> tell <B> a <B> floor <I> broker <I> to <B> buy <I> or <I> sell <I> an <B> investment <I> once <B> the <B> price <I> reaches <B> a <B> certain <I> level <I> . <O>
once <O> the <B> price <I> reaches <B> that <B> level <I> , <O> a <B> stop <I> order <I> turns <B> into <B> a <B> market <I> order <I> , <O> and <O> the <B> order <I> is <B> filled <I> at <B> whatever <B> price <I> the <B> broker <I> can <B> get <I> . <O>
stop <B> orders <I> are <B> sometimes <I> called <I> `` <B> stop-loss <I> '' <I> orders <I> because <B> they <B> are <B> frequently <I> used <I> to <B> protect <I> profits <B> or <O> limit <B> losses <B> . <O>
while <B> stop <B> orders <I> sound <B> similar <B> to <B> limit <B> orders <I> , <O> there <B> is <B> a <B> difference <I> : <O> sell <B> stops <I> must <B> be <I> entered <I> at <B> a <B> price <I> below <B> the <B> current <I> market <I> price <I> and <O> buy <B> stops <I> above <B> . <O>
in <B> contrast <B> , <O> sell <B> limit <I> orders <I> must <B> be <I> placed <I> above <B> the <B> market <I> price <I> and <O> buy <B> limit <I> orders <I> are <B> placed <I> below <B> . <O>
the <B> crash <I> in <B> october <B> 1987 <I> and <O> last <B> friday <I> 's <B> sell-off <I> painfully <B> taught <I> some <B> investors <I> exactly <B> what <B> stop <B> orders <I> will <B> and <I> wo <I> n't <O> do <B> . <O>
an <B> investor <I> who <B> may <B> have <I> placed <I> a <B> stop-loss <I> order <I> at <B> $ <B> 90 <I> under <B> a <B> stock <I> that <B> was <B> trading <I> at <B> $ <B> 100 <I> a <B> share <I> on <B> the <B> friday <I> before <B> the <B> crash <I> was <B> stunned <I> to <I> discover <I> that <B> the <B> order <I> was <B> filled <I> at <B> $ <B> 75 <I> when <B> the <B> stock <I> opened <B> at <B> that <B> price <I> on <B> monday <B> . <O>
stop-limit <B> order <I> : <O> stop-limit <B> orders <I> turn <B> into <B> limit <B> orders <I> when <B> an <B> investment <I> trades <B> at <B> the <B> price <I> specified <B> in <B> the <B> order <I> . <O>
unlike <B> stop <B> orders <I> -- <O> which <B> are <B> filled <I> at <B> the <B> market <I> price <I> when <B> the <B> stop <I> price <I> is <B> hit <I> -- <O> stop-limit <B> orders <I> demand <B> that <B> the <B> trades <I> be <B> made <I> only <B> at <B> the <B> specified <I> price <I> . <O>
if <B> it <B> ca <B> n't <I> be <I> made <I> at <B> that <B> price <I> , <O> it <B> does <B> n't <I> get <I> filled <I> . <O>
investors <B> who <B> wish <B> to <I> be <I> out <B> of <B> a <B> position <I> , <O> without <B> the <B> risk <I> of <B> receiving <B> a <B> worse-than-expected <I> price <I> from <B> a <B> market <I> order <I> , <O> may <B> use <I> this <B> type <I> of <B> order <B> to <B> specify <I> the <B> price <I> at <B> which <B> the <B> order <I> must <B> be <I> filled <I> . <O>
but <O> if <B> the <B> market <I> moves <B> quickly <B> enough <I> , <O> it <B> may <B> be <I> impossible <B> for <B> the <B> broker <I> to <B> carry <I> out <B> the <B> order <I> because <B> the <B> investment <I> has <B> passed <I> the <B> specified <I> price <I> . <O>
market-if-touched <B> order <I> : <O> market-if-touched <B> orders <I> are <B> like <B> stop <B> orders <I> in <B> that <I> they <B> become <B> market <B> orders <I> if <B> a <B> specified <I> price <I> is <B> reached <I> . <O>
however <B> , <O> unlike <B> a <B> buy-stop <I> order <I> , <O> a <B> buy <I> market-if-touched <I> order <I> is <B> entered <I> at <B> a <B> price <I> below <B> the <B> current <I> price <I> , <O> while <B> a <B> sell <I> market-if-touched <I> order <I> is <B> entered <I> at <B> a <B> price <I> above <B> it <B> . <O>
as <B> soon <I> as <B> the <B> market <I> trades <B> at <B> the <B> specified <I> price <I> the <B> floor <I> broker <I> will <B> fill <I> it <B> at <B> the <B> best <I> possible <I> price <I> . <O>
fill-or-kill <B> order <I> : <O> the <B> fill-or-kill <I> order <I> is <B> one <B> of <B> several <B> associated <B> with <B> the <B> timing <I> of <B> trades <B> . <O>
it <B> instructs <B> a <B> broker <I> to <B> buy <I> or <I> sell <I> an <B> investment <I> at <B> the <B> specified <I> price <I> or <O> better <B> . <O>
but <O> if <B> the <B> investment <I> ca <B> n't <I> be <I> bought <I> or <I> sold <I> immediately <B> , <O> the <B> order <I> is <B> automatically <I> canceled <I> . <O>
gregory <B> bessemer <I> , <O> who <B> came <B> in <B> second <B> in <B> the <B> stock <I> division <I> of <B> the <B> recently <I> completed <I> u.s. <I> trading <I> championship <I> , <O> says <B> he <B> uses <B> fill-or-kill <B> orders <I> almost <B> exclusively <I> when <B> trading <B> options <B> . <O>
`` <O> i <B> like <B> to <I> use <I> them <B> to <B> feel <I> out <B> the <B> market <I> , <O> '' <O> he <B> says <B> . <O>
`` <O> if <B> they <B> do <B> n't <I> fill <I> it <B> immediately <B> , <O> then <B> i <B> can <B> start <I> over <B> at <B> a <B> new <I> price <I> or <O> try <B> again <B> with <B> the <B> same <I> price <I> . <O> '' <O>
not-held <B> order <I> : <O> this <B> is <B> another <B> timing <I> order <I> . <O>
it <B> is <B> a <B> market <I> order <I> that <B> allows <B> floor <B> brokers <I> to <B> take <I> more <B> time <I> to <B> buy <I> or <I> sell <I> an <B> investment <I> , <O> if <B> they <B> think <B> they <B> can <B> get <I> a <B> better <I> price <I> by <B> waiting <B> . <O>
not-held <B> orders <I> , <O> which <B> are <B> also <I> known <I> as <B> `` <O> disregard <B> the <B> tape <I> '' <B> orders <I> , <O> are <B> always <I> done <I> at <B> the <B> customer <I> 's <B> risk <I> . <O>
one-cancels-the-other <B> order <I> : <O> this <B> is <B> really <B> two <B> orders <I> in <B> one <B> , <O> generally <B> for <B> the <B> same <I> security <I> or <I> commodity <I> , <O> instructing <B> floor <B> brokers <I> to <B> fill <I> whichever <B> order <I> they <B> can <B> first <B> and <O> then <O> cancel <B> the <B> other <I> order <I> . <O>
in <B> a <B> fast-moving <I> market <I> , <O> it <B> prevents <B> an <B> investor <I> from <B> getting <B> stuck <I> with <B> having <B> made <I> two <B> trades <I> on <B> the <B> same <I> security <I> . <O>
specific-time <B> order <I> : <O> this <B> type <I> of <B> order <B> couples <B> many <B> of <B> the <B> orders <I> described <B> above <B> with <B> instructions <B> that <B> the <B> order <I> must <B> be <I> carried <I> out <B> at <B> or <I> by <I> a <B> certain <I> time <I> . <O>
`` <O> on <B> the <I> close <I> '' <O> can <B> be <I> added <I> to <B> many <B> types <I> of <B> orders <B> . <O>
for <B> example <B> , <O> `` <O> market-on-close <B> orders <I> '' <O> must <B> be <B> filled <I> during <B> the <B> last <I> few <I> minutes <I> of <B> trading <B> for <B> the <B> day <I> at <B> a <B> price <I> that <B> is <B> within <B> the <B> official <I> closing <I> range <I> of <B> prices <B> as <B> determined <B> by <B> the <B> exchange <I> . <O>
`` <O> stop-close-only <B> orders <I> '' <O> are <B> stop <B> orders <I> that <B> only <B> become <B> active <B> during <B> the <B> closing <I> minutes <I> of <B> trading <B> . <O>
`` <O> day <B> orders <I> '' <O> expire <B> at <B> the <B> end <I> of <B> the <B> day <I> on <B> which <B> they <B> are <B> entered <I> , <O> `` <O> good-till-canceled <B> orders <I> '' <O> have <B> no <B> expiration <I> date <I> . <O>
most <B> brokers <I> assume <B> that <B> all <B> orders <I> are <B> day <B> orders <I> unless <B> specified <B> otherwise <B> . <O>
on <B> oct. <B> 19 <I> , <I> 1987 <I> , <O> some <B> investors <I> learned <B> the <B> consequences <I> of <B> entering <B> `` <O> good-til-canceled <B> limit <I> orders <I> '' <O> and <O> then <O> forgetting <B> about <B> them <B> . <O>
they <B> found <B> they <B> had <B> bought <I> stock <B> from <B> limit <B> orders <I> that <B> they <B> might <B> have <I> entered <I> weeks <B> or <I> months <I> earlier <B> and <O> had <B> forgotten <I> to <I> cancel <I> . <O>
it <B> is <B> always <B> the <B> responsibility <I> of <B> investors <B> to <B> keep <I> track <B> of <B> the <B> orders <I> they <B> have <B> placed <I> . <O>
investors <B> who <B> change <B> their <B> mind <I> about <B> buying <B> or <I> selling <I> after <B> an <B> order <I> has <B> been <I> filled <I> are <B> , <O> usually <B> , <O> stuck <B> with <B> the <B> consequences <I> . <O>
mr. <B> angrist <I> writes <B> on <B> the <B> options <I> and <I> commodities <I> markets <I> for <B> the <B> wall <I> street <I> journal <I> . <O>
in <B> sizing <B> up <B> the <B> risks <I> of <B> stock-market <B> investments <I> , <O> there <B> 's <B> probably <B> no <B> starting <I> place <I> better <B> than <B> `` <O> beta <B> . <O> '' <O>
but <O> investors <B> better <B> not <O> ignore <B> its <B> limitations <I> , <O> either <B> . <O>
beta <B> is <B> a <B> handy <I> gauge <I> that <B> measures <B> the <B> volatility <I> of <B> a <B> stock <I> or <I> stock <I> mutual <I> fund <I> . <O>
for <B> any <B> given <I> move <I> in <B> the <B> overall <I> market <I> , <O> it <B> suggests <B> how <B> steeply <I> that <B> particular <I> issue <I> might <B> rise <I> or <I> fall <I> . <O>
beta <B> figures <I> are <B> widely <B> available <I> and <O> easy <B> to <B> interpret <I> . <O>
the <B> beta <I> of <B> the <B> broad <I> market <I> , <O> typically <B> defined <I> as <B> the <B> standard <I> & <I> poor <I> 's <B> 500-stock <I> index <I> , <O> is <B> always <B> 1.0 <B> . <O>
so <O> a <B> stock <I> with <B> a <B> beta <I> of <B> 0.5 <B> is <B> half <B> as <I> volatile <I> , <O> one <B> at <B> 1.5 <B> is <B> 50 <B> % <I> more <B> volatile <I> , <O> and <O> so <B> on <I> . <O>
cautious <B> investors <I> should <B> generally <I> go <I> with <B> stocks <B> that <B> have <B> low <B> betas <I> . <O>
go <B> with <B> high-beta <B> stocks <I> to <B> get <I> the <B> biggest <I> payoff <I> from <B> a <B> bet <I> on <B> a <B> bull <I> market <I> . <O>
remember <B> , <O> though <B> , <O> that <O> beta <B> also <B> has <B> important <B> limitations <I> . <O>
`` <O> beta <B> is <B> only <B> part <I> of <B> the <B> risk <I> in <B> a <B> stock <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> william <B> f. <I> sharpe <I> , <O> the <B> stanford <I> university <I> emeritus <I> professor <I> who <B> developed <B> the <B> measure <I> . <O>
`` <O> there <B> is <B> risk <B> that <B> is <B> not <I> associated <I> with <B> market <B> moves <I> , <O> and <O> the <B> beta <I> does <B> n't <I> tell <I> you <B> the <B> magnitude <I> of <B> that <B> . <O> '' <O>
in <B> particular <B> , <O> beta <B> does <B> n't <I> measure <I> the <B> company <I> - <O> and <O> industry-specific <B> risk <I> associated <B> with <B> an <B> individual <I> stock <I> . <O>
that <B> `` <I> business <I> '' <I> risk <I> is <B> very <B> significant <I> for <B> an <B> investor <I> with <B> only <B> a <I> few <I> stocks <I> , <O> but <O> it <B> virtually <B> disappears <I> in <B> a <B> large <I> and <I> well-diversified <I> portfolio <I> . <O>
beta <B> is <B> also <B> a <B> poor <I> indicator <I> of <B> the <B> risk <I> in <B> stock <B> groups <I> that <B> march <B> to <B> their <B> own <I> drummer <I> . <O>
in <B> particular <B> , <O> the <B> prices <I> of <B> gold <B> and <O> other <B> precious-metals <I> stocks <I> shoot <B> up <B> and <I> down <I> , <O> but <O> the <B> stocks <I> tend <B> to <I> have <I> low <B> betas <I> because <B> their <B> moves <I> are <B> not <O> market-inspired <B> . <O>
concern <B> that <B> investors <B> could <B> misinterpret <I> such <B> readings <I> led <B> the <B> american <I> association <I> of <B> individual <B> investors <I> to <B> eliminate <I> beta <B> figures <I> for <B> precious-metals <B> funds <I> in <B> the <B> 1989 <I> edition <I> of <B> its <B> mutual-fund <I> guide <I> . <O>
`` <O> our <B> fear <I> was <B> people <B> would <B> look <I> just <B> at <B> the <B> beta <I> -lcb- <O> of <B> a <B> gold <I> fund <I> -rcb- <O> and <O> say <B> here <B> is <B> an <B> investment <I> with <B> very <B> low <I> risk <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> john <B> markese <I> , <O> director <B> of <B> research <B> for <B> the <B> chicago-based <I> group <I> . <O>
`` <O> in <B> reality <B> it <B> 's <B> very <B> volatile <I> , <O> but <O> the <B> movements <I> are <B> not <O> because <B> of <I> market <B> movements <I> . <O>
ready <B> to <B> review <I> the <B> riskiness <I> of <B> your <B> investment <I> portfolio <I> ? <O>
first <B> , <O> a <B> pop <I> quiz <I> . <O>
when <B> you <B> think <B> of <B> the <B> words <I> `` <I> risk <I> '' <I> and <I> `` <I> investment <I> , <O> '' <O> what <B> 's <B> the <B> specific <I> peril <I> that <B> comes <B> to <B> mind <B> ? <O>
pencils <B> down <B> . <O>
if <B> you <B> 're <B> like <B> most <B> people <I> , <O> you <B> said <B> it <B> 's <B> a <B> holding <I> that <B> goes <B> completely <B> sour <I> -- <B> maybe <I> a <B> bond <I> that <B> defaults <B> or <O> a <B> stock <I> whose <B> value <I> disappears <B> in <B> a <B> bankruptcy <I> proceeding <I> . <O>
`` <O> people <B> tend <B> to <I> see <I> risk <B> primarily <B> on <B> that <B> one <I> dimension <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> timothy <B> kochis <I> , <O> national <B> director <I> of <B> personal <B> financial <I> planning <I> for <B> accountants <B> deloitte <I> , <I> haskins <I> & <I> sells <I> . <O>
but <O> therein <B> lies <B> another <B> aspect <I> of <B> investment <B> risk <I> : <O> the <B> hazard <I> of <B> shaping <B> your <B> portfolio <I> to <B> avoid <I> one <B> or <I> more <I> types <I> of <B> risk <B> and <O> being <B> blind-sided <I> by <B> others <B> . <O>
this <B> is <B> clearly <B> not <O> good <B> news <I> to <B> all <B> you <I> people <I> who <B> sleep <B> like <B> babies <B> every <B> night <I> , <O> lulled <B> by <B> visions <B> of <B> your <B> money <I> sitting <B> risk-free <B> in <B> six-month <B> cds <I> . <O>
risk <B> wears <B> many <B> disguises <I> , <O> and <O> investments <B> that <B> are <B> low <B> in <B> one <B> type <I> of <B> obvious <B> risk <I> can <B> be <I> distressingly <B> high <I> in <B> other <B> , <I> less <I> obvious <I> kinds <I> . <O>
u.s. <B> treasury <I> bonds <I> , <O> for <B> example <B> , <O> are <B> supersafe <B> when <B> it <B> comes <B> to <B> returning <B> money <B> at <B> maturity <B> . <O>
but <O> their <B> value <I> as <B> investments <B> can <B> be <I> decimated <I> by <B> inflation <B> , <O> which <B> erodes <B> the <B> purchasing <I> power <I> of <B> bonds <B> ' <B> fixed-dollar <I> interest <I> payments <I> . <O>
risk <B> is <B> also <B> a <B> function <I> of <B> time <B> . <O>
when <B> financial <B> professionals <I> measure <B> risk <B> mathematically <B> , <O> they <B> usually <B> focus <B> on <B> the <B> volatility <I> of <B> short-term <B> returns <I> . <O>
stocks <B> are <B> much <B> riskier <I> than <B> treasury <B> bills <I> , <O> for <B> example <B> , <O> because <B> the <B> range <I> in <B> performance <B> from <B> the <B> best <I> years <I> to <B> the <B> worst <I> is <B> much <B> wider <I> . <O>
that <B> is <B> usually <I> measured <I> by <B> the <B> standard <I> deviation <I> , <O> or <O> divergence <B> , <O> of <B> annual <B> results <I> from <B> the <B> average <I> return <I> over <B> time <B> . <O>
but <O> investors <B> who <B> are <B> preoccupied <I> with <B> short-term <B> fluctuations <I> may <B> be <I> paying <I> too <B> little <I> attention <I> to <B> another <B> big <I> risk <I> -- <O> not <O> generating <B> enough <B> money <I> to <B> meet <I> long-term <B> financial <I> and <I> life-style <I> goals <I> . <O>
for <B> instance <B> , <O> some <B> investors <I> have <B> sworn <I> off <B> stocks <B> since <B> the <B> 1987 <I> market <I> crash <I> ; <O> last <B> friday <I> 's <B> debacle <I> only <B> reinforced <B> those <B> feelings <I> . <O>
but <O> the <B> stock <I> market <I> , <O> despite <B> some <B> stomach-churning <I> declines <I> , <O> has <B> far <I> outperformed <I> other <B> securities <I> over <B> extended <B> periods <I> . <O>
by <B> retreating <B> to <B> the <B> apparent <I> security <I> of <B> , <O> say <B> , <O> money-market <B> funds <I> , <O> investors <B> may <B> not <I> be <I> earning <I> enough <B> investment <I> return <I> to <B> pay <I> for <B> a <B> comfortable <I> retirement <I> . <O>
`` <O> that <B> 's <B> the <B> biggest <I> risk <I> of <B> all <B> -- <O> the <B> risk <I> of <B> not <O> meeting <B> your <B> objectives <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> steven <B> b. <I> enright <I> , <O> a <B> new <I> york <I> financial <I> planner <I> with <B> seidman <B> financial <I> services <I> . <O>
as <B> a <B> result <I> , <O> financial <B> advisers <I> say <B> they <B> take <B> several <B> steps <I> when <B> evaluating <B> the <B> riskiness <I> of <B> clients <B> ' <B> portfolios <I> . <O>

the <B> plan <I> is <B> talking <I> about <B> applicants <B> admitted <B> , <B> not <I> students <B> who <B> enroll <B> . <O>
since <B> the <B> `` <I> yield <I> '' <O> from <B> this <B> top <I> slice <I> of <B> applicants <B> is <B> relatively <B> low <I> , <O> boosting <B> admits <B> from <B> 40 <B> % <I> to <B> 50 <B> % <I> will <B> boost <I> registrants <B> from <B> about <B> 31 <I> % <I> to <B> 38 <B> % <I> of <B> the <B> class <I> . <O>
in <B> addition <B> , <O> perhaps <B> 5 <I> % <I> of <B> registrants <B> will <B> come <I> from <B> a <B> new <I> category <I> consisting <B> of <B> applicants <B> whose <B> academic <I> credentials <I> `` <O> narrowly <B> missed <I> '' <O> gaining <B> them <B> admission <B> in <B> the <B> first <I> category <I> . <O>
but <O> against <B> that <B> combined <I> increase <I> of <B> 12 <B> % <I> in <B> students <B> chosen <B> by <B> academic <B> criteria <I> , <O> the <B> plan <I> eliminates <B> a <B> large <I> category <I> in <B> which <B> admissions <B> now <B> are <B> based <I> on <B> grades <B> , <O> test <B> scores <I> and <O> `` <O> supplemental <B> points <I> '' <O> for <B> factors <B> such <B> as <I> high-school <B> curriculum <I> , <O> english-language <B> proficiency <I> and <O> an <B> essay <I> . <O>
this <B> category <I> now <B> accounts <B> for <B> about <B> 19 <I> % <I> of <B> admits <B> and <O> 22 <B> % <I> of <B> registrants <B> . <O>
the <B> plan <I> thus <B> will <B> decrease <I> by <B> 22 <B> % <I> , <O> for <B> a <B> net <I> loss <I> of <B> 10 <B> % <I> , <O> the <B> number <I> of <B> students <B> admitted <B> primarily <B> by <B> academic <B> criteria <I> . <O>
who <B> will <B> take <I> over <B> these <B> places <I> ? <O>
the <B> plan <I> creates <B> a <B> new <I> category <I> of <B> students <B> from <B> `` <O> socioeconomically <B> disadvantaged <I> backgrounds <I> , <O> '' <O> a <B> concept <I> not <B> yet <I> defined <I> , <O> and <O> gives <B> them <B> about <B> 10 <I> % <I> of <B> the <B> class <I> . <O>
one <B> of <B> the <B> plan <I> 's <B> authors <I> has <B> defended <I> the <B> `` <I> socioeconomic <I> disadvantage <I> '' <I> category <I> as <B> perhaps <B> making <B> more <B> sense <I> than <B> the <B> current <I> affirmative-action <I> preferences <I> based <B> on <B> race <B> . <O>
perhaps <B> it <B> does <B> . <O>
but <O> the <B> new <I> category <I> does <B> not <I> replace <I> or <I> reduce <I> berkeley <B> 's <B> broad <I> racial <I> preferences <I> . <O>
nor <O> will <O> students <B> from <B> racial-minority <B> groups <I> who <B> are <B> admitted <I> through <B> the <B> new <I> category <I> be <B> counted <I> against <B> the <B> affirmative-action <I> `` <I> target <I> '' <O> for <B> their <B> group <I> . <O>
the <B> plan <I> thus <B> places <B> a <B> large <I> new <I> affirmative-action <I> program <I> , <O> based <B> on <B> `` <O> socioeconomic <B> disadvantage <I> , <O> '' <O> on <B> top <B> of <B> the <B> existing <I> program <I> based <B> on <B> race <B> . <O>
the <B> role <I> of <B> academic <B> criteria <I> in <B> choosing <B> berkeley <B> 's <B> freshmen <I> can <B> only <I> decline <I> as <B> a <B> result <I> . <O>
stephen <B> r. <I> barnett <I> professor <B> of <B> law <B> university <B> of <B> california <B> berkeley <B> , <O> calif <B> . <O>
for <B> those <B> who <B> delight <B> in <B> the <B> misfortune <I> of <B> others <B> , <O> read <B> on <B> . <O>

often <B> con <B> artists <I> will <B> try <I> to <I> disarm <I> their <B> victims <I> by <B> emphasizing <B> similarities <B> between <B> them <B> . <O>
william <B> lynes <I> , <O> a <B> retired <I> engineer <I> from <B> lockheed <B> corp. <I> , <O> says <B> he <B> and <O> his <B> wife <I> , <O> lily <B> , <O> warmed <B> to <B> the <B> investment <I> pitches <I> of <B> a <B> penny-stock <I> peddler <I> from <B> stuart-james <B> co. <I> in <B> atlanta <B> after <O> the <B> broker <I> told <B> them <B> he <B> , <O> too <B> , <O> had <B> once <I> worked <I> with <B> lockheed <B> . <O>
the <B> lyneses <I> , <O> of <B> powder <B> springs <I> , <O> ga. <B> , <O> have <B> filed <I> suit <B> in <B> georgia <B> state <I> court <I> against <B> stuart <B> james <I> , <O> alleging <B> fraud <B> . <O>

they <B> say <B> the <B> broker <I> took <B> them <B> out <B> for <B> lunch <B> frequently <B> . <O>
he <B> urged <B> them <B> to <B> refer <I> their <B> friends <I> , <O> who <B> also <B> lost <B> money <B> . <O>
-lrb- <O> donald <B> trinen <I> , <O> an <B> attorney <I> for <B> the <B> penny-brokerage <I> firm <I> , <O> denies <B> the <B> fraud <I> allegations <I> and <O> says <B> the <B> lyneses <I> were <B> fully <I> apprised <I> that <B> they <B> were <B> pursuing <I> a <B> high-risk <I> investment <I> . <O> -rrb- <O>
`` <O> it <B> 's <B> not <O> uncommon <B> for <B> these <B> guys <I> to <B> send <I> pictures <B> of <B> themselves <B> or <O> their <B> families <I> to <B> ingratiate <I> themselves <B> to <B> their <B> clients <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> terree <B> bowers <I> , <O> chief <B> of <B> the <B> major-frauds <I> section <I> of <B> the <B> u.s. <I> attorney <I> 's <B> office <I> in <B> los <B> angeles <I> . <O>

anything <B> to <B> make <I> a <B> sale <I> . <O> '' <O>
experts <B> say <B> that <B> whatever <B> a <B> person <I> 's <B> particular <I> weak <I> point <I> , <O> timing <B> is <B> crucial <B> . <O>

what <B> to <B> do <I> ? <O>
first <B> , <O> generalize <B> . <O>
shorn <B> of <B> all <B> their <I> riders <I> , <I> special <I> provisions <I> , <I> and <I> other <I> bells <I> and <I> whistles <I> , <O> insurance <B> policies <I> can <B> still <I> be <I> grouped <I> under <B> two <B> broad <I> categories <I> : <O> so-called <B> pure <I> insurance <I> , <O> which <B> amasses <B> no <B> cash <I> value <I> in <B> the <B> policy <I> and <O> pays <B> off <B> only <B> upon <B> death <B> , <O> and <O> permanent <B> insurance <I> , <O> which <B> provides <B> not <B> only <I> a <B> death <I> benefit <I> but <B> also <I> a <B> cash <I> value <I> in <B> the <B> policy <I> that <B> can <B> be <I> used <I> in <B> various <B> ways <I> while <B> the <B> insured <I> is <B> still <B> alive <B> . <O>
if <B> all <B> you <B> want <B> is <B> death-benefit <B> coverage <I> , <O> pure <B> insurance <I> -- <O> a <B> term <I> policy <I> -- <O> gives <B> you <B> maximum <B> bang <I> for <B> your <B> buck <I> , <O> within <B> limits <B> . <O>
it <B> 's <B> much <B> cheaper <I> than <B> permanent <B> insurance <I> bought <B> at <B> the <B> same <I> age <I> . <O>
but <O> `` <O> term <B> '' <O> means <B> just <B> that <I> ; <O> the <B> policy <I> is <B> written <I> for <B> a <B> specific <I> time <I> period <I> only <I> and <O> must <B> be <I> renewed <I> when <B> it <B> expires <B> . <O>
it <B> may <B> also <I> stipulate <I> that <B> the <B> insured <I> must <B> pass <I> another <B> medical <I> exam <I> before <B> renewal <B> ; <O> if <B> you <B> flunk <B> -- <O> which <B> means <B> you <B> need <B> insurance <B> more <B> than <B> ever <B> -- <O> you <B> may <B> not <I> be <I> able <B> to <B> buy <I> it <B> . <O>
even <B> if <I> you <B> 're <B> healthy <B> and <O> can <B> renew <I> , <O> your <B> premium <I> will <B> go <I> up <B> sharply <B> because <B> you <B> 're <B> that <B> much <B> older <B> . <O>
so <O> term <B> insurance <I> may <B> not <I> be <I> as <B> cheap <I> as <B> it <B> looks <B> . <O>
there <B> are <B> all <B> sorts <I> of <B> variations <B> on <B> term <B> insurance <I> : <O> policies <B> structured <B> to <B> pay <I> off <B> your <B> mortgage <I> debt <I> , <O> term <B> riders <I> tacked <B> on <B> to <B> permanent <B> insurance <I> , <O> and <O> many <B> others <I> . <O>
one <B> variation <I> that <B> appealed <B> to <B> me <B> at <B> first <B> was <B> the <B> `` <I> money <I> smart <I> term <I> life <I> '' <I> policy <I> offered <B> by <B> amex <B> life <I> insurance <I> co. <I> , <O> the <B> american <I> express <I> unit <I> , <O> to <B> the <B> parent <I> company <I> 's <B> credit-card <I> holders <I> . <O>
upon <B> examination <B> , <O> however <B> , <O> i <B> wondered <B> whether <B> the <B> plan <I> made <B> a <B> lot <I> of <B> sense <B> . <O>
amex <B> said <B> it <B> would <B> charge <I> me <B> $ <B> 576 <I> a <B> year <I> for <B> $ <B> 100,000 <I> of <B> coverage <B> -- <O> and <O> would <B> pay <I> me <B> back <B> all <B> the <I> premiums <I> i <B> put <B> in <B> if <B> i <B> canceled <B> the <B> policy <I> after <B> 10 <B> years <I> . <O>
sounds <B> great <B> -- <O> or <O> does <O> it <B> ? <O>
first <B> , <O> if <B> i <B> canceled <B> , <O> i <B> 'd <B> have <I> no <B> more <I> insurance <I> , <O> a <B> not <I> insignificant <I> consideration <I> . <O>
second <B> , <O> the <B> $ <I> 5,760 <I> i <B> 'd <B> get <I> back <B> would <B> be <I> much <I> diminished <I> in <B> purchasing <B> power <I> by <B> 10 <B> years <I> of <B> inflation <B> ; <O> amex <B> , <I> not <I> i <I> , <O> would <B> get <I> the <B> benefit <I> of <B> the <B> investment <I> income <I> on <B> my <B> money <I> , <O> income <B> that <B> would <B> have <I> exceeded <I> the <B> inflation <I> rate <I> and <O> thus <B> given <B> the <B> company <I> a <B> real <I> profit <I> . <O>
third <B> and <O> most <B> important <I> , <O> amex <B> would <B> charge <I> me <B> a <B> far <I> higher <I> premium <I> than <B> other <B> reputable <I> companies <I> would <B> on <B> a <B> straight <I> term <I> policy <I> for <B> the <B> same <I> amount <I> ; <O> i <B> 'd <B> be <I> paying <I> so <B> heavily <I> just <B> to <B> have <I> the <B> option <I> of <B> getting <B> my <B> premiums <I> back <B> that <B> i <B> 'd <B> almost <I> have <I> to <I> cancel <I> to <B> make <I> the <B> whole <I> thing <I> worthwhile <B> . <O>

which <B> goes <B> to <I> show <I> that <B> the <B> first <I> law <I> applies <B> in <B> insurance <B> as <B> in <B> anything <B> else <B> : <O> there <B> is <B> no <B> free <I> lunch <I> , <O> there <B> is <B> only <B> marketing <I> . <O>
and <O> the <B> second <I> law <I> , <O> unique <B> to <B> insurance <B> ? <O>

always <B> . <O>
this <B> is <B> worth <B> remembering <B> when <B> insurers <B> and <O> their <B> salesmen <I> try <B> to <I> sell <I> you <B> permanent <B> insurance <I> , <O> the <B> kind <I> that <B> amasses <B> cash <B> value <I> . <O>
the <B> word <I> `` <I> death <I> '' <O> can <B> not <I> be <I> escaped <I> entirely <B> by <B> the <B> industry <I> , <O> but <O> salesmen <B> dodge <B> it <B> wherever <B> possible <B> or <O> cloak <B> it <B> in <B> euphemisms <B> , <O> preferring <B> to <I> talk <I> about <B> `` <B> savings <I> '' <I> and <I> `` <I> investment <I> '' <O> instead <B> . <O>
the <B> implication <I> is <B> that <O> your <B> permanent-insurance <I> policy <I> is <B> really <B> some <B> kind <I> of <B> cd <B> or <O> mutual-fund <B> account <I> with <B> an <B> added <I> feature <I> . <O>
that <B> is <B> gilding <B> the <B> lily <I> . <O>
the <B> fact <I> is <B> that <B> as <B> a <B> savings <I> or <I> investment <I> vehicle <I> , <O> insurance <B> generally <B> runs <B> a <B> poor <I> second <I> to <B> any <B> direct <I> investment <I> you <B> might <B> make <I> in <B> the <B> same <I> things <I> the <B> insurance <I> company <I> is <B> putting <I> your <B> money <I> into <B> . <O>
that <B> 's <B> because <B> you <B> have <B> to <I> pay <I> for <B> the <B> insurance <I> portion <I> of <B> the <B> policy <I> and <O> the <B> effort <I> required <B> to <B> sell <I> and <I> service <I> the <B> whole <I> package <I> . <O>
again <B> , <O> no <B> free <I> lunch <I> . <O>
this <B> is <B> reflected <I> in <B> a <B> built-in <I> mortality <I> cost <I> -- <O> in <B> effect <B> , <O> your <B> share <I> of <B> the <B> company <I> 's <B> estimated <I> liability <I> in <B> paying <B> off <B> beneficiaries <B> of <B> people <B> who <B> had <B> the <B> effrontery <I> to <B> die <I> while <B> under <B> its <B> protection <I> . <O>
and <O> in <B> most <B> cases <I> , <O> a <B> huge <I> hunk <I> of <B> your <B> premium <I> in <B> the <B> initial <I> year <I> or <I> two <I> of <B> the <B> the <I> policy <I> is <B> , <O> in <B> effect <B> , <O> paying <B> the <B> salesman <I> 's <B> commission <I> as <B> well <I> ; <O> investment <B> returns <I> on <B> most <B> policies <I> are <B> actually <B> negative <B> for <B> several <B> years <I> , <O> largely <B> because <B> of <I> this <B> . <O>
so <O> view <B> permanent <B> insurance <I> for <B> what <B> it <B> is <B> -- <O> a <B> compromise <I> between <B> pure <B> insurance <I> and <O> direct <B> investment <I> . <O>
the <B> simplest <I> , <I> most <I> traditional <I> form <I> of <B> permanent <B> insurance <I> is <B> the <B> straight <I> whole <I> life <I> policy <I> . <O>
you <B> pay <B> a <B> set <I> premium <I> for <B> a <B> set <I> amount <I> of <B> coverage <B> , <O> the <B> company <I> invests <B> that <B> premium <I> in <B> a <B> portfolio <I> of <B> its <B> choosing <I> , <O> and <O> your <B> cash <I> value <I> and <I> dividends <I> grow <B> over <B> the <B> years <I> . <O>
one <B> newer <I> wrinkle <I> , <O> so <B> called <I> single-premium <I> life <I> -lrb- <O> you <B> pay <B> for <B> the <B> whole <I> policy <I> at <B> once <B> -rrb- <O> , <O> has <B> been <I> immensely <B> popular <I> in <B> recent <B> years <I> for <B> tax <B> reasons <I> ; <O> the <B> insured <I> could <B> extract <I> cash <B> value <I> in <B> the <B> form <I> of <B> policy <B> `` <I> loans <I> , <O> '' <O> and <O> none <B> of <B> the <B> proceeds <I> were <B> taxable <B> even <B> though <I> they <B> included <B> gains <B> on <B> investment <B> . <O>
congress <B> closed <B> this <B> loophole <I> last <B> year <I> , <O> or <O> thought <B> it <B> did <B> . <O>
however <B> , <O> monarch <B> capital <I> corp. <I> of <B> springfield <B> , <O> mass. <B> , <O> has <B> developed <I> a <B> `` <I> combination <I> plan <I> '' <O> of <B> annuity <B> and <I> insurance <I> coverage <I> that <B> it <B> says <B> does <B> not <I> violate <I> the <B> new <I> regulations <I> and <O> that <O> allows <B> policy <B> loans <I> without <B> tax <B> consequences <I> . <O>
but <O> the <B> percentage <I> of <B> your <B> cash <I> reserve <I> that <B> you <B> can <B> borrow <I> tax-free <B> is <B> very <B> small <I> . <O>
i <B> 'm <B> not <I> prepared <I> in <B> any <B> case <I> to <B> put <I> that <B> much <I> money <I> into <B> a <B> policy <I> immediately <B> , <O> so <O> i <B> look <B> into <B> the <B> broad <I> category <I> called <B> universal <B> life <I> . <O>
hugely <B> popular <I> , <O> it <B> is <B> far <B> more <I> flexible <I> than <B> straight <B> whole <I> life <I> . <O>
i <B> can <B> adjust <I> the <B> amount <I> of <B> insurance <B> i <B> want <B> against <B> the <B> amount <I> going <B> into <B> investment <B> ; <O> i <B> can <B> pay <I> more <B> or <I> less <I> than <B> the <B> so-called <I> target <I> premium <I> in <B> a <B> given <I> year <I> ; <O> and <O> i <B> can <B> even <I> skip <I> payments <B> if <B> my <B> cash <I> reserves <I> are <B> enough <B> to <B> cover <I> the <B> insurance <I> portion <I> of <B> the <B> policy <I> . <O>

in <B> terms <B> of <B> days <B> lost <B> on <B> the <B> job <I> , <O> the <B> study <I> estimated <B> that <B> each <B> affected <I> employee <I> loses <B> about <B> 16 <I> work <I> days <I> a <B> year <I> because <B> of <I> stress <B> , <I> anxiety <I> or <I> depression <I> . <O>

while <B> lower <B> joblessness <I> is <B> generally <B> good <B> news <I> , <O> the <B> hefty <I> drop <I> last <B> month <I> indicates <B> that <B> the <B> economy <I> is <B> n't <I> slowing <I> down <B> as <B> much <I> as <B> hoped <B> -- <O> despite <B> a <B> doubling <I> of <B> interest <B> rates <I> over <B> the <B> last <I> 16 <I> months <I> . <O>

and <O> the <B> fees <I> investors <B> pay <B> for <B> indexing <B> run <B> a <B> few <I> pennies <I> for <B> each <B> $ <I> 100 <I> of <B> assets <B> -- <O> a <B> fraction <I> of <B> the <B> cost <I> of <B> active <B> managers <I> . <O>
that <B> 's <B> because <B> computers <B> do <B> most <B> of <B> the <B> work <I> , <O> and <O> low <B> trading <I> activity <I> keeps <B> a <B> lid <I> on <B> commission <B> costs <I> . <O>

among <B> the <B> souped-up <I> indexing <I> strategies <I> : <O> indexed <B> portfolios <I> can <B> be <I> built <I> around <B> thousands <B> of <B> stocks <B> , <O> or <O> just <B> a <I> few <I> dozen <I> , <O> rather <B> than <I> being <B> restricted <I> to <B> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> companies <I> . <O>

one <B> reason <I> for <B> these <B> hybrids <I> is <B> that <O> indexing <B> 's <B> rapid <I> growth <I> is <B> slowing <I> , <O> particularly <B> for <B> those <B> `` <I> plain <I> vanilla <I> '' <I> funds <I> that <B> mirror <B> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> . <O>

westridge <B> capital <I> has <B> used <I> enhanced <B> indexing <I> techniques <I> to <B> beat <I> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> 's <B> returns <I> by <B> 2.5 <B> to <I> 3 <I> percentage <I> points <I> over <B> the <B> past <I> four <I> years <I> , <O> with <B> the <B> same <I> risk <I> level <I> as <B> holding <B> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> stocks <I> , <O> according <B> to <B> james <B> carder <I> , <O> the <B> firm <I> 's <B> president <I> . <O>

prudential <B> currently <B> is <B> seeking <I> approval <B> to <B> offer <I> a <B> new <I> fund <I> offering <B> a <B> return <I> equal <B> to <B> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> index <I> plus <B> 5\/100 <B> of <B> a <B> percentage <I> point <I> . <O>
an <B> added <I> feature <I> is <B> that <B> the <B> slighty <I> improved <I> return <I> would <B> be <I> guaranteed <I> by <B> prudential <B> . <O>
there <B> are <B> many <B> other <I> strategies <I> to <B> bolster <I> the <B> returns <I> of <B> index <B> funds <I> . <O>
they <B> include <B> : <O>
limited <B> risk <I> funds <I> : <O>
these <B> guarantee <B> protection <B> against <B> stock <B> market <I> declines <I> while <B> still <B> passing <B> along <B> most <B> gains <I> . <O>
here <B> a <B> fund <I> may <B> promise <I> to <I> pay <I> back <B> , <O> say <B> , <O> $ <B> 95 <I> of <B> every <B> $ <I> 100 <I> invested <B> for <B> a <B> year <I> , <O> even <B> if <I> the <B> market <I> goes <B> much <B> lower <I> . <O>
the <B> fund <I> could <B> invest <I> $ <B> 87 <I> for <B> one <B> year <I> in <B> treasury <B> bills <I> yielding <B> 8 <B> % <I> to <B> return <I> the <B> guaranteed <I> $ <I> 95 <I> . <O>
that <B> leaves <B> $ <B> 13 <I> , <O> which <B> could <B> be <I> used <I> to <B> buy <I> s&p <B> 500 <I> options <I> that <B> will <B> nearly <I> match <I> any <B> gain <I> in <B> the <B> s&p <I> index <I> . <O>
manager <B> replication <I> funds <I> : <O>
say <B> a <B> big <I> investor <I> is <B> interested <B> in <B> growth <B> stocks <I> . <O>
instead <B> of <I> hiring <B> one <B> of <B> the <B> many <I> active <I> managers <I> specializing <B> in <B> growth <B> stocks <I> , <O> indexers <B> can <B> design <I> a <B> portfolio <I> around <B> the <B> same <I> stocks <I> ; <O> the <B> portfolio <I> will <B> be <I> maintained <I> by <B> computer <B> , <O> reducing <B> both <B> fees <B> and <O> , <O> in <B> theory <B> , <O> risk <B> -lrb- <O> because <B> of <I> the <B> large <I> number <I> of <B> stocks <B> -rrb- <O> . <O>
`` <O> we <B> see <B> a <B> lot <I> of <B> interest <B> in <B> those <B> kind <I> of <B> things <B> , <O> '' <O> says <B> frank <B> salerno <I> , <O> a <B> vice <I> president <I> of <B> bankers <B> trust <I> . <O>
`` <O> people <B> comfortable <B> with <B> the <B> passive <I> approach <I> are <B> using <I> them <B> for <B> other <B> strategies <I> . <O> '' <O>
tilt <B> funds <I> : <O>
this <B> is <B> an <B> index <I> fund <I> with <B> a <B> bet <I> . <O>
instead <B> of <I> replicating <B> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> or <O> some <B> other <I> index <I> exactly <B> , <O> some <B> stocks <I> are <B> overweighted <I> or <I> underweighted <I> in <B> the <B> portfolio <I> . <O>
one <B> simple <I> approach <I> is <B> to <B> exclude <I> s&p <B> 500 <I> companies <I> considered <B> bankruptcy <B> candidates <I> ; <O> this <B> can <B> avoid <I> weak <B> sisters <I> , <O> but <O> also <B> can <B> hurt <I> when <B> a <B> company <I> like <B> chrysler <B> corp. <I> rebounds <B> . <O>
another <B> approach <I> : <O> an <B> investor <I> with <B> $ <B> 100 <I> million <I> might <B> use <I> $ <B> 75 <I> million <I> to <B> buy <I> the <B> s&p <I> 500 <I> index <I> and <O> spend <B> the <B> other <I> $ <I> 25 <I> million <I> on <B> a <B> favorite <I> group <I> of <B> stocks <B> . <O>
specialized <B> funds <I> : <O>
indexes <B> can <B> be <I> constructed <I> to <B> serve <I> social <B> goals <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> eliminating <B> the <B> stocks <I> of <B> companies <B> doing <B> business <B> in <B> south <B> africa <I> . <O>
other <B> funds <I> have <B> been <I> designed <I> to <I> concentrate <I> on <B> stocks <B> in <B> a <B> geographic <I> area <I> in <B> order <O> to <B> encourage <I> local <B> investment <I> . <O>
pennsylvania <B> state <I> employees <I> retirement <I> system <I> , <O> for <B> example <B> , <O> has <B> about <B> $ <I> 130 <I> million <I> invested <B> in <B> a <B> fund <I> of <B> 244 <B> companies <I> that <B> are <B> either <B> pennsylvania-based <B> or <O> have <B> 25 <B> % <I> of <B> their <B> work <I> forces <I> in <B> the <B> state <I> . <O>
short <B> interest <I> on <B> the <B> new <I> york <I> stock <I> exchange <I> declined <B> for <B> the <B> second <I> consecutive <I> month <I> , <O> this <B> time <I> 4.2 <B> % <I> , <O> while <B> the <B> american <I> stock <I> exchange <I> reported <B> its <B> third <I> consecutive <I> record <I> month <I> of <B> short <B> interest <I> . <O>
the <B> big <I> board <I> reported <B> that <O> short <B> interest <I> dropped <B> to <B> 523,920,214 <B> shares <I> as <B> of <B> oct. <B> 13 <I> from <B> 547,347,585 <B> shares <I> in <B> mid-september <B> . <O>

amex <B> short <I> interest <I> has <B> been <I> heading <I> upward <B> since <B> mid-december <B> , <O> with <B> increases <B> in <B> each <B> month <I> since <B> then <B> except <B> at <B> mid-july <B> . <O>
traders <B> who <B> sell <B> short <B> borrow <B> stock <B> and <O> sell <B> it <B> , <O> betting <B> that <B> the <B> stock <I> 's <B> price <I> will <B> decline <I> and <O> that <B> they <B> can <B> buy <I> the <B> shares <I> back <B> later <B> at <B> a <B> lower <I> price <I> for <B> return <B> to <B> the <B> lender <I> . <O>
short <B> interest <I> is <B> the <B> number <I> of <B> shares <B> that <B> have <B> n't <I> yet <I> been <I> purchased <I> for <B> return <B> to <B> lenders <B> . <O>
although <B> a <B> substantial <I> short <I> position <I> reflects <B> heavy <B> speculation <I> that <B> a <B> stock <I> 's <B> price <I> will <B> decline <I> , <O> some <B> investors <I> consider <B> an <B> increase <I> in <B> short <B> interest <I> bullish <B> because <B> the <B> borrowed <I> shares <I> eventually <B> must <B> be <I> bought <I> back <B> . <O>
fluctuation <B> in <B> short <B> interest <I> of <B> certain <B> stocks <I> also <B> may <B> be <I> caused <I> partly <B> by <B> arbitraging <B> . <O>
the <B> figures <I> occasionally <B> include <B> incomplete <B> transactions <I> in <B> restricted <B> stock <I> . <O>

sen. <B> john <I> kerry <I> -lrb- <O> d. <B> , <O> mass <B> . <O> -rrb- <O>
for <B> vietnamese <B> , <O> these <B> are <B> tricky <O> , <O> often <B> treacherous <B> , <O> times <B> . <O>

here <B> is <B> how <B> three <B> vietnamese <I> are <B> coping <I> with <B> change <B> : <O>
the <B> tire <I> king <I>
nguyen <B> van <I> chan <I> is <B> living <B> proof <I> that <B> old <B> ways <I> die <B> hard <B> . <O>
mr. <B> chan <I> used <B> to <I> be <I> an <B> oddity <I> in <B> hanoi <B> : <O> a <B> private <I> entrepreneur <I> . <O>
his <B> business <I> success <I> made <B> him <B> an <B> official <I> target <I> in <B> pre-reform <B> days <I> . <O>
mr. <B> chan <I> , <O> now <B> 64 <B> years <I> old <B> , <O> invented <B> a <B> fountain <I> pen <I> he <B> and <O> his <B> family <I> produced <B> from <B> plastic <B> waste <I> . <O>
later <B> , <O> he <B> marketed <B> glue <B> . <O>
both <B> products <I> were <B> immensely <B> popular <I> . <O>
for <B> his <B> troubles <I> , <O> mr. <B> chan <I> was <B> jailed <I> three <B> times <I> between <B> 1960 <B> and <I> 1974 <I> . <O>
though <B> his <B> operation <I> was <B> registered <I> and <O> used <B> only <B> scrap <I> , <O> he <B> was <B> accused <I> of <B> conducting <B> illegal <B> business <I> and <O> possessing <B> illegal <B> materials <I> . <O>
once <B> he <B> was <B> held <I> for <B> three <B> months <I> without <B> being <B> charged <I> . <O>
things <B> were <B> supposed <I> to <I> change <I> when <B> vietnam <B> 's <B> economic <I> reforms <I> gathered <B> pace <B> , <O> and <O> for <B> awhile <B> they <B> did <B> . <O>
after <B> years <B> of <B> experimenting <B> , <O> mr. <B> chan <I> produced <B> a <B> heavy-duty <I> bicycle <I> tire <I> that <B> outlasted <B> its <B> state-produced <I> rival <I> . <O>
by <B> 1982 <B> , <O> he <B> was <B> selling <I> thousands <B> of <B> tires <B> . <O>
newspapers <B> published <B> articles <B> about <B> him <B> , <O> and <O> he <B> was <B> hailed <I> as <B> `` <O> the <B> tire <I> king <I> . <O> '' <O>
his <B> efforts <I> earned <B> a <B> gold <I> medal <I> at <B> a <B> national <I> exhibition <I> -- <O> and <O> attracted <B> renewed <B> attention <I> from <B> local <B> authorities <I> . <O>
district <B> police <I> in <B> 1983 <B> descended <B> on <B> his <B> suburban <I> home <I> , <O> which <B> he <B> and <O> his <B> large <I> family <I> used <B> as <B> both <B> residence <I> and <I> factory <I> , <O> and <O> demanded <B> proof <B> the <B> house <I> and <I> equipment <I> were <B> his <B> . <O>
he <B> produced <B> it <B> . <O>
`` <O> that <B> was <B> the <B> first <I> time <I> they <B> lost <B> and <O> i <B> won <B> , <O> '' <O> he <B> says <B> . <O>
he <B> was <B> further <I> questioned <I> to <B> determine <I> if <B> he <B> was <B> `` <O> a <B> real <I> working <I> man <I> or <O> an <B> exploiter <I> . <O> '' <O>

but <O> a <B> few <I> days <I> later <B> the <B> police <I> accused <B> him <B> of <B> stealing <B> electricity <B> , <O> acquiring <B> rubber <B> without <B> permission <B> and <O> buying <B> stolen <B> property <I> . <O>
warned <B> he <B> was <B> to <I> be <I> jailed <I> again <B> , <O> he <B> fled <B> to <B> the <B> countryside <I> . <O>
his <B> family <I> was <B> given <I> three <B> hours <I> to <B> leave <I> before <O> the <B> house <I> and <I> contents <I> were <B> confiscated <I> . <O>
with <B> only <B> the <I> clothes <I> they <B> were <B> wearing <I> , <O> family <B> members <I> moved <B> to <B> a <B> home <I> owned <B> by <B> one <B> of <B> mr. <B> chan <I> 's <B> sons <I> . <O>
after <B> six <B> months <I> on <B> the <B> run <I> , <O> mr. <B> chan <I> learned <B> the <B> order <I> for <B> his <B> arrest <I> had <B> been <I> canceled <I> . <O>
he <B> rejoined <B> his <B> family <I> in <B> january <B> 1984 <I> and <O> began <B> the <B> long <I> struggle <I> for <B> justice <B> , <O> pressing <B> everyone <B> from <B> hanoi <B> municipal <I> officials <I> to <B> national <B> assembly <I> deputies <I> for <B> restoration <B> of <B> his <B> rights <I> . <O>
he <B> and <O> his <B> family <I> kept <B> afloat <B> by <B> repairing <B> bicycles <B> , <O> selling <B> fruit <B> and <O> doing <B> odd <B> jobs <I> . <O>
mr. <B> chan <I> achieved <B> a <B> breakthrough <I> in <B> 1987 <B> -- <O> and <O> became <B> a <B> minor <I> celebrity <I> again <B> -- <O> when <B> his <B> story <I> was <B> published <I> in <B> a <B> weekly <I> newspaper <I> . <O>
in <B> 1988 <B> , <O> 18 <B> months <I> after <O> the <B> sixth <I> congress <I> formally <B> endorsed <B> family-run <B> private <I> enterprise <I> , <O> district <B> authorities <I> allowed <B> mr. <B> chan <I> to <B> resume <I> work <B> . <O>
by <B> late <B> last <I> year <I> he <B> was <B> invited <I> back <B> as <B> `` <O> the <B> tire <I> king <I> '' <O> to <B> display <I> his <B> products <I> at <B> a <B> national <I> exhibition <I> . <O>
national <B> leaders <I> stopped <B> by <B> his <B> stand <I> to <B> commend <I> his <B> achievements <I> . <O>
mr. <B> chan <I> now <B> produces <B> 1,000 <B> bicycle <I> and <I> motorbike <I> tires <I> a <B> month <I> and <O> 1,000 <B> tins <I> of <B> tire-patching <B> glue <I> in <B> the <B> son <I> 's <B> small <I> house <I> . <O>
eighteen <B> people <I> pack <B> the <B> house <I> 's <B> two <I> rooms <I> -- <O> the <B> chans <I> , <O> four <B> of <B> their <B> 10 <I> children <I> with <B> spouses <B> , <O> and <O> eight <B> of <B> 22 <B> grandchildren <I> . <O>

the <B> primitive <I> operations <I> also <B> burst <B> out <B> the <B> back <I> door <I> into <B> a <B> small <I> courtyard <I> , <O> where <B> an <B> ancient <I> press <I> squeezes <B> rubber <B> solution <I> into <B> a <B> flat <I> strip <I> and <O> newly <B> made <I> tires <I> are <B> cooled <I> in <B> a <B> bathtub <I> filled <B> with <B> water <B> . <O>
mr. <B> chan <I> talks <B> optimistically <B> of <B> expanding <B> , <O> maybe <B> even <I> moving <I> into <B> the <B> import-export <I> field <I> . <O>
first <B> , <O> however <B> , <O> he <B> has <B> unfinished <B> business <I> . <O>
when <B> district <B> authorities <I> allowed <B> him <B> to <B> resume <I> manufacturing <B> , <O> they <B> released <B> only <B> one <I> of <B> his <B> machines <I> . <O>
they <B> did <B> n't <I> return <I> the <B> rubber <I> stocks <I> that <B> represent <B> his <B> capital <I> . <O>

the <B> editor <I>
nguyen <B> ngoc <I> seemed <B> an <B> obvious <I> choice <I> when <B> the <B> vietnamese <I> writers <I> association <I> was <B> looking <I> for <B> a <B> new <I> editor <I> to <B> reform <I> its <B> weekly <I> newspaper <I> , <O> van <B> nghe <I> . <O>
after <B> the <B> sixth <I> congress <I> , <O> journalists <B> seized <B> the <B> opportunity <I> provided <B> by <B> the <B> liberalization <I> to <B> probe <I> previously <B> taboo <I> subjects <I> . <O>
mr. <B> ngoc <I> , <O> 57 <B> years <I> old <I> , <O> had <B> solid <B> reformist <I> credentials <I> : <O> he <B> had <B> lost <I> his <B> official <I> position <I> in <B> the <B> association <I> in <B> he <B> early <I> 1980s <I> because <B> he <B> questioned <B> the <B> intrusion <I> of <B> politics <B> into <B> literature <B> . <O>
appointed <B> editor <B> in <B> chief <B> in <B> july <B> 1987 <I> , <O> mr. <B> ngoc <I> rapidly <B> turned <B> the <B> staid <I> van <I> nghe <I> into <B> vietnam <B> 's <B> hottest <I> paper <I> . <O>
circulation <B> soared <B> as <B> the <B> weekly <I> went <B> way <B> beyond <B> standard <B> literary <I> themes <I> to <B> cover <I> vietnamese <B> society <I> and <O> its <B> ills <I> . <O>
readers <B> were <B> electrified <I> by <B> the <B> paper <I> 's <B> audacity <I> and <O> appalled <B> by <B> the <B> dark <I> side <I> of <B> life <B> it <B> uncovered <B> . <O>
one <B> article <I> recounted <B> a <B> decade-long <I> struggle <I> by <B> a <B> wounded <I> soldier <I> to <B> prove <I> , <O> officially <B> , <O> he <B> was <B> alive <B> . <O>
another <B> described <B> how <B> tax-collection <B> officials <I> in <B> thanh <B> hoa <I> province <I> one <B> night <I> stormed <B> through <B> homes <B> and <O> confiscated <B> rice <B> from <B> starving <B> villagers <I> . <O>
the <B> newspaper <I> also <B> ran <B> a <B> series <I> of <B> controversial <B> short <I> stories <I> by <B> nguyen <B> huy <I> thiep <I> , <O> a <B> former <I> history <I> teacher <I> , <O> who <B> stirred <B> debate <B> over <B> his <B> interpretation <I> of <B> vietnamese <B> culture <I> and <O> took <B> a <B> thinly <I> veiled <I> swipe <I> at <B> writers <B> who <B> had <B> blocked <I> his <B> entry <I> into <B> their <B> official <I> association <I> . <O>
van <B> nghe <I> quickly <B> made <B> influential <B> enemies <I> . <O>
`` <O> those <B> who <B> manage <B> ideology <B> and <O> a <B> large <I> number <I> of <B> writers <B> reacted <B> badly <B> '' <O> to <B> the <B> restyled <I> paper <I> , <O> says <B> lai <B> nguyen <I> an <I> , <O> a <B> literary <I> critic <I> . <O>

for <B> the <B> leadership <I> , <O> that <B> was <B> too <B> painful <I> to <B> bear <I> . <O> '' <O>
the <B> ` <I> billionaire <I> ' <O>
nguyen <B> thi <I> thi <I> is <B> vietnam <B> 's <B> entrepreneur <I> of <B> the <B> 1980s <I> . <O>
her <B> challenge <I> is <B> to <B> keep <I> her <B> fledgling <I> empire <I> on <B> top <B> in <B> the <B> 1990s <I> . <O>
mrs. <B> thi <I> did <B> n't <I> wait <I> for <B> the <B> reforms <I> to <B> get <I> her <B> start <I> . <O>
she <B> charged <B> ahead <B> of <B> the <B> government <I> and <O> the <B> law <I> to <B> establish <I> hochiminh <B> city <I> food <I> co. <I> as <B> the <B> biggest <I> rice <I> dealer <I> in <B> the <B> country <I> . <O>
her <B> success <I> , <O> which <B> included <B> alleviating <I> an <B> urban <I> food <I> shortage <I> in <B> the <B> early <I> 1980s <I> , <O> helped <B> persuade <I> hanoi <B> to <B> take <I> the <B> reform <I> path <I> . <O>
her <B> story <I> is <B> becoming <I> part <B> of <B> local <B> folklore <I> . <O>
a <B> lifelong <I> revolutionary <I> with <B> little <B> education <I> who <B> fought <B> both <B> the <B> french <I> and <O> the <B> u.s.-backed <I> saigon <I> regime <I> , <O> she <B> switched <B> effortlessly <B> to <B> commerce <B> after <B> the <B> war <I> . <O>
her <B> instincts <I> were <B> capitalistic <B> , <O> despite <B> her <B> background <I> . <O>
as <B> she <B> rode <B> over <B> regulations <B> , <O> only <B> her <I> friendship <I> with <B> party <B> leaders <I> , <O> including <B> nguyen <B> van <I> linh <I> , <O> then <B> ho <B> chi <I> minh <I> city <I> party <I> secretary <I> , <O> kept <B> her <B> out <B> of <B> jail <B> . <O>
following <B> mr. <B> linh <I> 's <B> appointment <I> as <B> secretary-general <B> of <B> the <B> party <I> at <B> the <B> sixth <I> congress <I> , <O> mrs. <B> thi <I> has <B> become <I> the <B> darling <I> of <B> `` <O> doi <B> moi <I> '' <O> , <O> the <B> vietnamese <I> version <I> of <B> perestroika <B> . <O>

`` <O> some <B> people <I> call <B> me <B> the <B> communist <I> billionaire <I> , <O> '' <O> she <B> has <B> told <I> visitors <B> . <O>
actually <B> , <O> 67-year-old <B> mrs. <I> thi <I> is <B> about <B> as <I> poor <I> as <B> almost <B> everyone <I> else <I> in <B> this <B> impoverished <I> land <I> . <O>

the <B> heart <I> of <B> the <B> business <I> is <B> the <B> purchase <I> of <B> rice <B> and <O> other <B> commodities <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> corn <B> and <I> coffee <I> , <O> from <B> farmers <B> in <B> the <B> south <I> , <O> paying <B> with <B> fertilizer <B> , <O> farm <B> tools <I> and <O> other <B> items <I> . <O>

the <B> company <I> operates <B> a <B> fleet <I> of <B> trucks <B> and <I> boats <I> to <B> transport <I> the <B> commodities <I> to <B> its <B> warehouses <I> . <O>

charles <B> bradford <I> , <O> an <B> analyst <I> with <B> merrill <B> lynch <I> capital <I> markets <I> , <O> said <B> higher <B> prices <I> for <B> galvanized <B> and <I> cold-rolled <I> products <I> offset <B> lower <B> prices <I> for <B> bar <B> , <I> hot-rolled <I> and <I> structural <I> steel <I> . <O>
