however <B> , <O> he <B> noted <B> that <B> steel <B> mill <I> bookings <I> are <B> up <B> from <B> early <B> summer <I> levels <I> , <O> and <O> that <B> he <B> expects <B> the <B> company <I> to <B> improve <I> its <B> cost <I> performance <I> in <B> the <B> fourth <I> quarter <I> . <O>
in <B> the <B> first <I> nine <I> months <I> , <O> profit <B> was <B> $ <B> 113 <I> million <I> , <O> or <O> $ <B> 3.04 <I> a <B> share <I> , <O> on <B> sales <B> of <B> $ <B> 3.19 <I> billion <I> , <O> compared <B> with <B> $ <B> 204.5 <I> million <I> , <O> or <O> $ <B> 5.76 <I> a <B> share <I> , <O> on <B> sales <B> of <B> $ <B> 3.03 <I> billion <I> , <O> a <B> year <I> earlier <B> . <O>
the <B> `` <I> seismic <I> '' <I> activity <I> of <B> a <B> financial <I> market <I> bears <B> a <B> resemblance <I> to <B> the <B> seismic <I> activity <I> of <B> the <B> earth <I> . <O>
when <B> things <B> are <B> quiet <I> -lrb- <O> low <B> volatility <I> -rrb- <O> , <O> the <B> structures <I> on <B> which <B> markets <B> stand <B> can <B> be <I> relatively <B> inefficient <I> and <O> still <B> perform <I> their <B> functions <I> adequately <B> . <O>
however <B> , <O> when <B> powerful <B> forces <I> start <B> shaking <I> the <B> market <I> 's <B> structure <I> , <O> the <O> more <B> `` <I> earthquake-resistant <I> '' <O> it <B> is <B> , <O> the <O> better <O> its <B> chance <I> for <B> survival <B> . <O>
america <B> 's <B> financial <I> markets <I> do <B> not <I> yet <I> have <I> all <B> the <I> required <I> modern <I> features <I> required <B> to <B> make <I> them <B> fully <B> `` <I> aftershock-resistant <I> . <O> '' <O>
investors <B> lack <B> equal <B> access <I> to <B> the <B> markets <I> ' <B> trading <I> arena <I> and <O> its <B> information <I> . <O>
that <B> structural <I> lack <I> is <B> crucial <B> because <B> investors <B> are <B> the <B> only <I> source <I> of <B> market <B> liquidity <I> . <O>
and <O> liquidity <B> is <B> what <B> markets <B> need <B> to <B> damp <I> quakes <B> and <I> aftershocks <I> . <O>
in <B> today <B> 's <B> markets <I> , <O> specialists <B> -lrb- <O> on <B> the <B> new <I> york <I> stock <I> exchange <I> -rrb- <O> and <O> `` <B> upstairs <I> '' <I> market <I> makers <I> -lrb- <O> in <B> the <B> over-the-counter <I> market <I> -rrb- <O> are <B> the <B> only <I> market <I> participants <I> allowed <B> to <I> play <I> a <B> direct <I> role <I> in <B> the <B> price-determination <I> process <I> . <O>
when <B> they <B> halt <B> trading <B> , <O> all <B> market <I> liquidity <I> is <B> gone <B> . <O>
and <O> when <B> any <B> component <I> of <B> the <B> market <I> -- <O> cash <B> , <I> futures <I> or <I> options <I> -- <O> loses <B> liquidity <B> , <O> the <B> price <I> discovery <I> system <I> -lrb- <O> the <B> way <I> prices <B> are <B> determined <I> -rrb- <O> becomes <B> flawed <B> or <O> is <B> lost <I> entirely <B> for <B> a <B> time <I> . <O>
last <B> friday <I> the <I> 13th <I> -lrb- <O> as <B> well <I> as <I> two <B> years <I> ago <B> this <B> week <I> -rrb- <O> the <B> markets <I> became <B> unlinked <B> . <O>
when <B> that <B> happened <B> , <O> `` <B> seismic <I> '' <I> tremors <I> of <B> fear <B> -- <O> much <B> like <B> the <B> shock <I> waves <I> created <B> by <B> an <B> earthquake <I> -- <O> coursed <B> through <B> the <B> market <I> and <O> increased <B> the <B> market <I> 's <B> volatility <I> . <O>
lack <B> of <B> important <B> , <I> needed <I> information <I> can <B> cause <I> fear <B> . <O>
fear <B> is <B> the <B> father <I> of <B> panic <B> . <O>
panic <B> frequently <B> results <B> in <B> irrational <B> behavior <I> . <O>
and <O> in <B> financial <B> markets <I> , <O> irrational <B> behavior <I> is <B> sometimes <I> translated <I> into <B> catastrophe <B> . <O>
when <B> market <B> tremors <I> start <B> , <O> it <B> is <B> crucial <B> that <B> as <B> much <I> information <I> about <B> transaction <B> prices <I> and <O> the <B> supply-demand <I> curve <I> -lrb- <O> buy <B> and <I> sell <I> orders <I> at <B> various <B> prices <I> -rrb- <O> be <B> made <I> available <B> to <B> all <B> , <O> not <B> just <I> to <B> market <B> makers <I> . <O>
because <B> of <I> a <B> lack <I> of <B> information <B> and <I> access <I> , <O> many <B> investors <I> -- <O> including <B> the <B> very <I> ones <I> whose <B> buying <I> power <I> could <B> restore <I> stability <B> and <O> damp <B> volatility <B> -- <O> are <B> forced <I> to <I> stand <I> on <B> the <B> sidelines <I> when <B> they <B> are <B> most <I> needed <I> , <O> because <B> of <I> their <B> ignorance <I> of <B> important <B> market <I> information <I> . <O>

contrary <B> to <B> some <B> opinions <I> , <O> the <B> trading <I> activities <I> of <B> specialists <B> and <O> other <B> market <I> makers <I> do <B> not <I> provide <I> liquidity <B> to <B> the <B> market <I> as <B> a <B> whole <I> . <O>
what <B> market <B> makers <I> provide <B> is <B> immediacy <B> , <O> a <B> very <I> valuable <I> service <I> . <O>
liquidity <B> is <B> not <O> a <B> service <I> . <O>
it <B> is <B> a <B> market <I> attribute <I> -- <O> the <B> ability <I> to <B> absorb <I> selling <B> orders <I> without <B> causing <B> significant <B> price <I> changes <I> in <B> the <B> absence <I> of <B> news <B> . <O>
market <B> makers <I> buy <B> what <B> investors <B> wish <B> to <I> sell <I> ; <O> their <B> business <I> is <B> reselling <I> these <B> unwanted <I> positions <I> as <B> quickly <I> as <B> possible <B> to <B> other <B> investors <I> , <O> and <O> at <B> a <B> profit <I> . <O>
as <B> a <B> result <I> , <O> while <B> any <B> one <I> customer <I> may <B> purchase <I> immediacy <B> by <B> selling <B> to <B> a <B> market <I> maker <I> -lrb- <O> which <B> is <B> micro-liquidity <B> for <B> the <B> investor <I> -rrb- <O> , <O> the <B> market <I> as <B> a <B> whole <I> remains <B> in <B> the <B> same <I> circumstances <I> it <B> was <B> before <B> the <B> transaction <I> : <O> the <B> unwanted <I> position <I> is <B> still <B> an <B> unwanted <I> position <I> ; <O> only <B> the <I> identity <I> of <B> the <B> seller <I> has <B> changed <I> . <O>
in <B> fact <B> it <B> can <B> be <I> argued <I> that <B> increasing <B> capital <B> commitments <I> by <B> market <B> makers <I> -lrb- <O> a <B> result <I> of <B> some <B> post-1987 <I> crash <I> studies <I> -rrb- <O> also <B> increases <B> market <B> volatility <I> , <O> since <B> the <O> more <O> securities <B> are <B> held <I> by <B> market <B> makers <I> at <B> any <B> given <I> time <I> , <O> the <O> more <O> selling <B> pressure <I> is <B> overhanging <I> the <B> market <I> . <O>
in <B> an <B> open <I> electronic <I> system <I> , <O> any <B> investor <I> wishing <B> to <I> pay <I> for <B> real-time <B> access <I> to <B> the <B> trading <I> arena <I> through <B> a <B> registered <I> broker-dealer <I> would <B> be <I> able <B> to <B> see <I> the <B> entire <I> supply-demand <I> curve <I> -lrb- <O> buy <B> and <I> sell <I> orders <I> at <B> each <B> price <I> -rrb- <O> entered <B> by <B> dealers <B> and <I> investors <I> alike <B> , <O> and <O> to <B> enter <I> and <I> execute <I> orders <B> . <O>
current <B> quotations <I> would <B> reflect <I> the <B> combined <I> financial <I> judgment <I> of <B> all <B> market <I> participants <I> -- <O> not <B> just <I> those <B> of <B> intermediaries <B> who <B> become <B> extremely <B> risk-averse <I> during <B> times <B> of <B> crisis <B> . <O>

were <O> we <B> smart <B> or <I> just <I> lucky <I> ? <O>
i <B> 'm <B> not <O> certain <B> . <O>
but <O> i <B> am <B> sure <B> we <B> need <B> to <I> maximize <I> our <B> `` <I> earthquake <I> '' <I> protection <I> by <B> making <B> certain <B> that <B> our <B> market <I> structures <I> let <B> investors <B> add <B> their <B> mighty <I> shock-damping <I> power <I> to <B> our <B> nation <I> 's <B> markets <I> . <O>

now <B> you <B> see <B> it <B> , <O> now <B> you <B> do <B> n't <O> . <O>
the <B> recession <I> , <O> that <B> is <B> . <O>
the <B> economy <I> 's <B> stutter <I> steps <I> leave <B> investors <B> wondering <B> whether <O> things <B> are <B> slowing <I> down <B> or <O> speeding <B> up <B> . <O>
so <B> often <I> are <O> government <B> statistics <I> revised <B> that <B> they <B> seem <B> to <I> resemble <I> a <B> spinning <I> weather <I> vane <I> . <O>
for <B> the <B> past <I> seven <I> years <I> , <O> investors <B> have <B> had <I> the <B> wind <I> at <B> their <B> backs <I> , <O> in <B> the <B> form <I> of <B> a <B> generally <I> growing <I> economy <I> . <O>
some <B> may <B> have <I> forgotten <I> -- <O> and <O> some <B> younger <I> ones <I> may <B> never <I> have <I> experienced <I> -- <O> what <B> it <B> 's <B> like <B> to <B> invest <I> during <B> a <B> recession <I> . <O>
different <B> tactics <I> are <B> called <I> for <B> , <O> as <B> losing <B> money <B> becomes <B> easier <B> and <O> making <B> money <B> becomes <B> tougher <B> . <O>
for <B> those <B> investors <I> who <B> believe <B> -- <O> or <O> fear <O> -- <O> that <O> 1990 <B> will <B> be <I> a <B> recession <I> year <I> , <O> many <B> economists <I> and <I> money <I> managers <I> agree <B> on <B> steps <B> that <B> can <B> be <I> taken <I> to <B> lower <I> the <B> risks <I> in <B> a <B> portfolio <I> . <O>
in <B> a <B> nutshell <I> , <O> pros <B> advise <B> investors <B> who <B> expect <B> a <B> slowdown <I> to <B> hold <I> fewer <B> stocks <I> than <B> usual <B> and <O> to <B> favor <I> shares <B> of <B> big <B> companies <I> in <B> `` <B> defensive <I> '' <I> industries <I> . <O>
a <B> heavy <I> dose <I> of <B> cash <B> is <B> prescribed <I> , <O> along <B> with <B> a <B> heavier-than-usual <I> allotment <I> to <B> bonds <B> -- <O> preferably <B> government <B> bonds <I> . <O>
it <B> 's <B> tempting <B> to <B> think <I> these <B> defensive <I> steps <I> can <B> be <I> delayed <I> until <B> a <B> recession <I> is <B> clearly <B> at <B> hand <B> . <O>
but <O> that <B> may <B> not <I> be <I> possible <B> , <O> because <B> recessions <B> often <B> take <B> investors <B> by <B> surprise <B> . <O>
`` <O> they <B> always <B> seem <B> to <I> come <I> a <B> bit <I> later <B> than <B> you <B> expect <B> . <O>
when <B> they <B> do <B> hit <I> , <O> they <B> hit <B> fast <B> , <O> '' <O> says <B> david <B> a. <I> wyss <I> , <O> chief <B> financial <I> economist <I> at <B> the <B> data <I> resources <I> division <I> of <B> mcgraw-hill <B> inc <I> . <O>
though <B> he <B> himself <B> does <B> n't <I> expect <I> a <B> recession <I> soon <B> , <O> mr. <B> wyss <I> advises <B> people <B> who <B> do <B> that <B> `` <O> the <B> best <I> thing <I> to <B> be <I> in <B> is <B> long <O> that <B> is <B> , <B> 20-year <I> to <I> 30-year <I> treasury <I> bonds <I> . <O> '' <O>
the <B> reason <I> is <B> simple <B> , <O> mr. <B> wyss <I> says <B> : <O> `` <O> interest <B> rates <I> almost <B> always <I> decline <B> during <B> recession <B> . <O> '' <O>
as <B> surely <I> as <B> a <B> seesaw <I> tilts <B> , <O> falling <B> interest <I> rates <I> force <B> up <B> the <B> price <I> of <B> previously <B> issued <I> bonds <I> . <O>
they <B> are <B> worth <B> more <B> because <B> they <B> pay <B> higher <B> interest <I> than <B> newly <B> issued <I> bonds <I> do <B> . <O>
that <B> effect <I> holds <B> true <B> for <B> both <B> short-term <I> and <I> long-term <I> bonds <I> . <O>
but <O> short-term <B> bonds <I> ca <B> n't <I> rise <I> too <B> much <I> , <O> because <B> everyone <B> knows <B> they <B> will <O> be <B> redeemed <I> at <B> a <B> preset <I> price <I> fairly <B> soon <I> . <O>
long-term <B> bonds <I> , <O> with <B> many <B> years <I> left <B> before <B> maturity <B> , <O> swing <B> more <B> widely <I> in <B> price <B> . <O>
but <O> not <B> just <I> any <I> bonds <I> will <B> do <I> . <O>
corporate <B> bonds <I> `` <O> are <B> usually <B> not <O> a <B> good <I> bet <I> in <B> a <B> recession <I> , <O> '' <O> mr. <B> wyss <I> says <B> . <O>
as <B> times <B> get <B> tougher <B> , <O> investors <B> fret <B> about <B> whether <B> companies <B> will <B> have <I> enough <B> money <I> to <B> pay <I> their <B> debts <I> . <O>
this <B> hurts <B> the <B> price <I> of <B> corporate <B> bonds <I> . <O>
also <B> , <O> he <B> notes <B> , <O> `` <O> most <B> corporate <I> bonds <I> are <B> callable <B> . <O> '' <O>
that <B> means <B> that <B> a <B> corporation <I> , <O> after <B> a <B> specified <I> amount <I> of <B> time <B> has <B> passed <I> , <O> can <B> buy <I> back <B> its <B> bonds <I> by <B> paying <B> investors <B> the <B> face <I> value <I> -lrb- <O> plus <O> , <O> in <B> some <B> cases <I> , <O> a <B> sweetener <I> -rrb- <O> . <O>
when <B> interest <B> rates <I> have <B> dropped <I> , <O> it <B> makes <B> sense <B> for <B> corporations <B> to <B> do <I> just <B> that <I> ; <O> they <B> then <B> save <B> on <B> interest <B> costs <I> . <O>
but <O> the <B> investors <I> are <B> left <I> stranded <I> with <B> money <B> to <B> reinvest <I> at <B> a <B> time <I> when <B> interest <B> rates <I> are <B> puny <B> . <O>
if <B> corporate <B> bonds <I> are <B> bad <B> in <B> recessions <B> , <O> junk <B> bonds <I> are <B> likely <B> to <B> be <I> the <B> worst <I> of <B> all <B> . <O>
it <B> 's <B> an <B> `` <I> absolute <I> necessity <I> '' <O> to <B> get <I> out <B> of <B> junk <B> bonds <I> when <B> a <B> recession <I> is <B> in <B> the <B> offing <I> , <O> says <B> avner <B> arbel <I> , <O> professor <B> of <B> finance <B> at <B> cornell <B> university <I> . <O>
`` <O> such <B> bonds <I> are <B> very <B> sensitive <I> to <B> the <B> downside <I> , <O> and <O> this <B> could <B> be <I> a <B> disaster <I> . <O> '' <O>
municipal <B> bonds <I> are <B> generally <B> a <B> bit <I> safer <I> than <B> corporate <B> bonds <I> in <B> a <B> recession <I> , <O> but <O> not <B> as <I> safe <I> as <B> bonds <B> issued <B> by <B> the <B> federal <I> government <I> . <O>
during <B> an <B> economic <I> slump <I> , <O> local <B> tax <I> revenues <I> often <B> go <B> down <B> , <O> raising <B> the <B> risks <I> associated <B> with <B> at <B> least <I> some <B> municipals <I> . <O>
and <O> , <O> like <B> corporates <B> , <O> many <B> municipal <I> bonds <I> are <B> callable <B> . <O>
but <O> a <B> few <I> experts <I> , <O> going <B> against <B> the <B> consensus <I> , <O> do <B> n't <I> think <I> bonds <B> would <B> help <I> investors <B> even <B> if <I> a <B> recession <I> is <B> in <B> the <B> offing <I> . <O>

by <B> the <B> time <I> a <B> recession <I> is <B> `` <O> official <B> '' <O> -lrb- <O> two <B> consecutive <I> quarters <I> of <B> declining <B> gross <I> national <I> product <I> -rrb- <O> , <O> much <B> of <B> the <B> damage <I> to <B> stocks <B> has <B> already <I> been <I> done <I> - <O> and <O> , <O> in <B> the <B> typical <I> case <I> , <O> the <B> recession <I> is <B> already <B> half <B> over <I> . <O>
about <B> six <I> months <I> before <B> a <B> recession <I> ends <B> , <O> stocks <B> typically <B> begin <B> to <I> rise <I> again <B> , <O> as <B> investors <B> anticipate <B> a <B> recovery <I> . <O>

and <O> it <B> 's <B> way <B> above <B> the <B> ratio <I> -lrb- <O> 7.5 <B> times <I> cash <I> flow <I> -rrb- <O> that <B> bigger <B> companies <I> are <B> selling <I> for <B> . <O>

that <B> raised <B> hopes <B> that <B> interest <B> rates <I> will <B> continue <I> to <I> move <I> lower <B> . <O>

first <B> , <O> there <B> 's <B> the <B> name <I> : <O> `` <O> asset-backed <B> securities <I> . <O> '' <O>
better <B> than <B> all <B> those <I> offers <I> you <B> get <B> to <B> buy <I> securities <B> backed <B> by <B> nothing <B> . <O>
and <O> there <B> 's <B> more <B> . <O>
the <B> assets <I> backing <B> the <B> securities <I> come <B> from <B> some <B> of <B> the <B> country <I> 's <B> biggest <B> -- <O> and <O> most <B> secure <I> -- <O> institutions <B> . <O>

their <B> yields <I> are <B> higher <B> than <B> those <B> of <B> u.s. <B> treasury <I> issues <I> . <O>
and <O> the <B> booming <I> market <I> has <B> already <I> attracted <I> many <B> of <B> the <B> nation <I> 's <B> biggest <I> institutional <I> investors <I> . <O>
ready <B> to <B> jump <I> ? <O>
well <B> , <O> think <B> twice <B> . <O>
the <B> concept <I> may <B> be <I> simple <B> : <O> take <B> a <B> bunch <I> of <B> loans <B> , <O> tie <B> them <B> up <B> in <B> one <B> neat <I> package <I> , <O> and <O> sell <B> pieces <B> of <B> the <B> package <I> to <B> investors <B> . <O>
but <O> the <B> simplicity <I> may <B> be <I> misleading <B> . <O>
skeptics <B> say <B> the <B> slightly <I> higher <I> returns <I> are <B> n't <O> enough <B> to <B> compensate <I> for <B> the <B> extra <I> risk <I> . <O>
they <B> warn <B> that <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> are <B> only <B> as <B> good <I> as <B> the <B> assets <I> and <I> credit <I> backing <I> that <B> support <B> them <B> -- <O> and <O> those <B> are <B> hard <B> to <B> evaluate <I> . <O>
moreover <B> , <O> the <B> securities <I> were <B> introduced <I> only <B> about <I> 4 <I> 1\/2 <I> years <I> ago <B> ; <O> the <B> biggest <I> unknown <I> is <B> how <B> they <B> will <B> fare <I> in <B> a <B> recession <I> . <O>
`` <O> a <B> lot <I> of <B> this <B> stuff <I> really <B> is <B> in <B> untested <B> waters <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> owen <B> carney <I> , <O> director <B> of <B> the <B> investment <I> securities <I> division <I> of <B> the <B> u.s. <I> comptroller <I> of <B> the <B> currency <I> . <O>
`` <O> we <B> do <B> n't <I> know <I> how <B> this <B> whole <I> market <I> will <B> work <I> in <B> a <B> serious <I> economic <I> downturn <I> . <O> '' <O>
such <B> concerns <I> , <O> however <B> , <O> have <B> n't <I> stopped <I> asset-backed <B> securities <I> from <B> becoming <B> one <B> of <B> wall <B> street <I> 's <B> hottest <I> new <I> products <I> . <O>
since <B> the <B> spring <I> of <B> 1985 <B> , <O> financial <B> alchemists <I> have <B> transformed <I> a <B> wide <I> variety <I> of <B> debt <B> into <B> these <B> new <I> securities <I> . <O>
they <B> have <B> sold <I> issues <B> backed <B> by <B> car <B> loans <I> , <O> boat <B> loans <I> and <O> recreational-vehicle <B> loans <I> . <O>
they <B> have <B> offered <I> bundles <B> of <B> homeequity <B> loans <I> , <O> as <B> well <I> as <I> packages <B> of <B> loans <B> used <B> to <B> buy <I> vacation <B> time-shares <I> . <O>
last <B> year <I> , <O> there <B> was <B> an <B> issue <I> of <B> `` <O> death-backed <B> bonds <I> '' <O> -- <O> securities <B> backed <B> by <B> loans <B> to <B> life-insurance <B> policyholders <I> . <O>
some <B> predict <B> there <B> will <B> be <I> `` <O> third <B> world <I> bonds <I> , <O> '' <O> backed <B> by <B> loans <B> to <B> brazil <B> , <O> argentina <B> and <O> other <B> debt-ridden <I> nations <I> . <O>
and <O> the <B> biggest <I> volume <I> this <B> year <I> has <B> been <I> on <B> securities <B> backed <B> by <B> credit-card <B> receivables <I> , <O> sometimes <B> known <I> as <B> `` <O> plastic <B> bonds <I> . <O> '' <O>
`` <O> this <B> is <B> the <B> heyday <I> of <B> debt <B> , <O> '' <O> says <B> james <B> grant <I> , <O> editor <B> of <B> grant <B> 's <B> interest <I> rate <I> observer <I> , <O> a <B> newsletter <I> . <O>
`` <O> before <O> the <B> sun <I> sets <B> on <B> the <B> '80s <I> , <O> it <B> seems <B> nothing <B> will <B> be <I> left <I> unhocked <I> . <O> '' <O>
the <B> result <I> is <B> a <B> $ <I> 45 <I> billion <I> market <I> , <O> according <B> to <B> securities <B> data <I> co <I> . <O>
that <B> includes <B> more <B> than <I> $ <I> 9.5 <I> billion <I> issued <B> through <B> august <B> of <B> this <B> year <I> , <O> up <B> sharply <B> from <B> $ <B> 6.5 <I> billion <I> in <B> the <B> comparable <I> 1988 <I> period <I> -- <B> and <I> more <B> than <B> in <B> all <B> of <B> 1987 <B> . <O>
most <B> issues <I> have <B> been <I> sold <I> to <B> professional <B> money <I> managers <I> , <O> pension <B> funds <I> , <O> bank <B> trust <I> departments <I> and <O> other <B> institutions <I> . <O>
but <O> wealthy <B> individuals <I> also <B> have <B> been <I> jumping <I> in <B> , <O> and <O> lately <B> brokers <B> have <B> been <I> pushing <I> smaller <B> investors <I> into <B> the <B> asset-backed <I> market <I> . <O>
the <B> entry <I> fee <I> is <B> affordable <B> : <O> issues <B> typically <B> are <B> sold <I> in <B> minimum <B> denominations <I> of <B> $ <B> 1,000 <I> . <O>
`` <O> we <B> expect <B> additional <B> offerings <I> '' <O> of <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> targeted <B> toward <B> individual <B> investors <I> , <O> says <B> bill <B> addiss <I> , <O> a <B> senior <I> vice <I> president <I> at <B> shearson <B> lehman <I> hutton <I> inc <I> . <O>
the <B> process <I> typically <B> begins <B> when <B> an <B> institution <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> citibank <B> or <O> sears <B> , <I> roebuck <I> & <I> co. <I> , <O> takes <B> a <B> pool <I> of <B> credit-card <B> or <I> other <I> receivables <I> and <O> sells <B> them <B> to <B> a <B> specially <I> created <I> trust <I> . <O>
the <B> trust <I> then <B> issues <B> securities <B> -- <O> generally <B> due <I> in <B> five <B> years <I> or <I> less <I> -- <O> that <B> are <B> underwritten <I> by <B> wall <B> street <I> brokerage <I> firms <I> and <O> offered <B> to <B> investors <B> . <O>
issues <B> typically <B> come <B> with <B> `` <O> credit <B> enhancements <I> , <O> '' <O> such <B> as <I> a <B> bank <I> letter <I> of <B> credit <B> , <O> and <O> thus <B> have <I> received <I> high <B> credit <I> ratings <I> . <O>
enthusiasts <B> say <B> the <B> booming <I> market <I> has <B> opened <I> up <B> a <B> valuable <I> new <I> source <I> of <B> funds <B> to <B> issuers <B> , <O> while <B> providing <B> a <B> valuable <I> new <I> investment <I> for <B> individuals <B> and <I> institutions <I> . <O>
asset-backed <B> securities <I> `` <O> are <B> an <B> attractive <I> investment <I> compared <B> to <B> bank <B> certificates <I> of <B> deposit <B> or <O> other <B> corporate <I> bonds <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> craig <B> j. <I> goldberg <I> , <O> managing <B> director <I> and <O> head <B> of <B> the <B> asset-backed <I> securities <I> group <I> at <B> merrill <B> lynch <I> capital <I> markets <I> . <O>
but <O> skeptics <B> question <B> whether <B> asset-backed <B> bonds <I> offer <B> sufficient <B> rewards <I> to <B> compensate <I> for <B> the <B> extra <I> risks <I> . <O>
consider <B> a <B> $ <I> 500 <I> million <I> offering <I> of <B> 9 <B> % <I> securities <I> issued <B> last <B> spring <I> and <O> backed <B> by <B> citibank <B> credit-card <I> receivables <I> . <O>
the <B> triple-a-rated <I> issue <I> offered <B> a <B> yield <I> of <B> only <B> about <I> 0.5 <I> percentage <I> point <I> above <B> four-year <B> treasury <I> issues <I> . <O>
on <B> a <B> $ <I> 10,000 <I> investment <I> , <O> that <B> 's <B> a <B> difference <I> of <B> only <B> $ <I> 50 <I> a <B> year <I> . <O>
that <B> kind <I> of <B> spread <B> can <B> be <I> critical <B> for <B> money <B> managers <I> who <B> buy <B> bonds <B> in <B> large <B> quantities <I> and <O> whose <B> livelihood <I> depends <B> on <B> outperforming <B> the <B> money <I> manager <I> across <B> the <B> street <I> . <O>
but <O> for <B> individuals <B> who <B> buy <B> much <B> smaller <I> amounts <I> and <O> care <B> less <B> about <B> relative <B> performance <I> than <B> in <B> preserving <B> what <B> they <B> have <B> , <O> that <B> margin <I> is <B> meaningless <B> . <O>
`` <O> if <B> you <B> 're <B> in <B> the <B> bond <I> business <I> playing <B> the <B> relative-performance <I> derby <I> , <O> then <B> even <B> an <I> extra <I> 25 <I> basis <I> points <I> -lrb- <O> 0.25 <B> percentage <I> point <I> -rrb- <O> becomes <B> an <B> important <I> consideration <I> on <B> a <B> career <I> basis <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> mr. <B> grant <I> . <O>
`` <O> but <O> if <B> you <B> 're <B> an <B> individual <I> investing <B> money <B> and <O> trying <B> to <I> get <I> it <B> back <B> again <B> , <O> then <B> that <B> is <B> n't <O> of <B> overwhelming <B> importance <I> . <O> '' <O>
moreover <B> , <O> the <B> interest <I> on <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> is <B> fully <B> taxable <I> , <O> while <B> interest <B> on <B> treasury <B> issues <I> is <B> tax-free <B> at <B> the <B> state <I> and <I> local <I> level <I> . <O>
that <B> 's <B> why <B> some <B> investment <I> managers <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> alex <B> powers <I> , <O> a <B> vice <I> president <I> of <B> chase <B> manhattan <I> bank <I> 's <B> private <I> banking <I> division <I> , <O> do <B> n't <I> recommend <I> most <B> asset-backed <I> issues <I> for <B> individuals <B> in <B> high-tax <B> states <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> new <B> york <I> or <O> california <B> . <O>
but <O> mr. <B> powers <I> has <B> purchased <I> asset-backed <B> issues <I> for <B> individuals <B> with <B> tax-deferred <B> accounts <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> retirement <B> plans <I> . <O>
he <B> points <B> out <B> that <B> institutions <B> buying <B> asset-backed <B> issues <I> in <B> large <B> quantities <I> can <B> earn <I> higher <B> spreads <I> over <B> treasurys <B> than <B> individuals <B> buying <B> smaller <B> amounts <I> . <O>
another <B> concern <I> is <B> liquidity <B> , <O> or <O> how <B> easily <I> a <B> security <I> can <B> be <I> converted <I> into <B> cash <B> . <O>
the <B> secondary <I> , <I> or <I> resale <I> , <I> market <I> for <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> is <B> relatively <B> new <I> and <O> much <B> less <I> active <I> than <B> for <B> treasury <B> issues <I> . <O>
that <B> could <B> make <I> it <B> tricky <B> for <B> investors <B> who <B> need <B> to <I> sell <I> their <B> holdings <I> quickly <B> before <B> the <B> securities <I> mature <B> . <O>
that <B> 's <B> particularly <B> true <I> , <O> analysts <B> say <B> , <O> for <B> certain <B> of <B> the <B> securities <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> those <B> backed <B> by <B> time-share <B> loans <I> . <O>
`` <O> you <B> could <B> see <I> massive <B> gyrations <I> here <B> because <B> it <B> 's <B> such <B> a <I> thinly <I> traded <I> market <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> jonathan <B> s. <I> paris <I> , <O> a <B> vice <I> president <I> of <B> european <B> investors <I> inc. <I> , <O> a <B> new <I> york <I> investment-management <I> firm <I> . <O>
in <B> addition <B> , <O> an <B> investor <I> who <B> wants <B> to <I> know <I> the <B> daily <I> value <I> of <B> treasury <B> bonds <I> , <O> or <O> corporate <B> bonds <I> traded <B> on <B> the <B> new <I> york <I> stock <I> exchange <I> , <O> can <B> simply <I> check <I> newspaper <B> listings <I> . <O>
there <B> are <B> n't <O> any <B> such <I> listings <I> for <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> . <O>
evaluating <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> poses <B> another <B> problem <I> . <O>
investors <B> , <O> for <B> instance <B> , <O> may <B> mistakenly <I> assume <I> that <B> the <B> bank <I> or <I> company <I> that <B> originally <B> held <B> the <B> assets <I> is <B> guaranteeing <I> the <B> securities <I> . <O>
it <B> is <B> n't <O> . <O>
the <B> front <I> cover <I> of <B> the <B> prospectus <I> for <B> the <B> citibank <I> credit-card <I> receivables <I> offering <I> points <B> out <B> in <B> bold <B> capital <I> letters <I> that <B> the <B> certificates <I> represent <B> an <B> interest <I> only <B> in <B> the <B> specially <I> created <I> trust <I> and <O> `` <O> do <B> not <I> represent <I> interests <B> in <B> or <O> obligations <B> of <B> the <B> banks <I> , <O> citibank <B> n.a. <I> , <O> citicorp <B> or <O> any <B> affiliate <I> thereof <I> . <O> '' <O>
in <B> other <B> words <I> , <O> if <B> there <B> 's <B> a <B> problem <I> , <O> do <B> n't <I> expect <I> citibank <B> to <B> come <I> to <B> the <B> rescue <I> . <O>
the <B> prospectus <I> also <B> notes <B> that <B> the <B> securities <I> are <B> not <I> guaranteed <I> by <B> any <B> government <I> agency <I> . <O>
that <B> means <B> investors <B> have <B> to <I> focus <I> on <B> the <B> quality <I> of <B> the <B> debt <I> that <B> lies <B> beneath <B> the <B> securities <I> , <O> as <B> well <I> as <I> on <B> the <B> credit <I> enhancement <I> for <B> the <B> issue <I> and <O> the <B> credit <I> ratings <I> the <B> issue <I> has <B> received <I> . <O>
that <B> also <B> is <B> n't <O> easy <B> . <O>
take <B> the <B> `` <I> credit <I> enhancements <I> , <O> '' <O> which <B> typically <B> include <B> a <B> bank <I> letter <I> of <B> credit <B> or <O> insurance <B> from <B> a <B> bond-insurance <I> company <I> . <O>
the <B> letter <I> of <B> credit <B> typically <B> is <B> not <I> offered <I> by <B> the <B> bank <I> selling <B> the <B> assets <I> to <B> back <I> the <B> securities <I> . <O>
nor <O> does <O> it <B> cover <B> the <B> entire <I> portfolio <I> . <O>
details <B> of <B> credit <B> enhancements <I> vary <B> widely <B> from <B> issue <B> to <B> issue <B> . <O>
still <B> , <O> they <B> play <B> a <B> crucial <I> role <I> in <B> winning <B> top <B> ratings <I> for <B> most <B> asset-backed <I> issues <I> -- <O> which <B> in <B> turn <B> is <B> why <B> the <B> yield <I> above <B> treasurys <B> is <B> so <B> slim <I> . <O>
but <O> skeptics <B> ask <B> why <B> you <B> should <B> bother <I> buying <I> this <B> stuff <I> when <B> you <B> can <B> get <I> only <B> slightly <I> lower <B> yields <I> on <B> government-guaranteed <B> paper <I> . <O>
when <B> you <B> buy <B> an <B> asset-backed <I> issue <I> , <O> you <B> take <B> the <B> risk <I> that <B> a <B> bank <I> or <O> an <B> insurer <I> could <B> run <I> into <B> unexpected <B> difficulties <I> . <O>
if <B> a <B> bank <I> 's <B> credit <I> rating <I> was <B> lowered <I> because <B> of <I> , <O> say <B> , <O> its <B> loans <I> to <B> third <B> world <I> nations <I> , <O> that <B> could <B> also <I> affect <I> the <B> ratings <I> , <I> liquidity <I> and <I> prices <I> of <B> the <B> asset-backed <I> issues <I> that <B> the <B> bank <I> supports <B> . <O>
underwriters <B> insist <B> these <B> issues <I> are <B> constructed <I> to <B> withstand <I> extremely <B> tough <I> economic <I> conditions <I> . <O>
but <O> despite <B> the <B> credit <I> enhancements <I> , <O> despite <B> the <B> high <I> ratings <I> , <O> some <B> money <I> managers <I> still <B> worry <B> that <B> a <B> recession <I> could <B> wreak <I> havoc <B> on <B> the <B> underlying <I> assets <I> . <O>
at <B> a <B> time <I> when <B> americans <B> are <B> leveraged <B> to <B> their <B> eyeballs <I> , <O> asset-backed <B> investors <I> may <B> be <I> taking <I> a <B> heady <I> gamble <I> that <B> consumers <B> will <B> be <I> able <B> to <B> repay <I> loans <B> in <B> hard <B> times <I> . <O>
at <B> the <B> very <I> least <I> , <O> a <B> recession <I> would <B> prompt <I> investors <B> to <B> buy <I> the <B> highest-quality <I> bonds <I> they <B> can <B> find <I> -- <O> that <B> is <B> , <O> treasurys <B> . <O>
that <B> could <B> widen <I> the <B> yield <I> spread <I> between <B> treasurys <B> and <O> asset-backed <B> securities <I> , <O> as <B> well <I> as <I> make <B> it <B> tougher <B> to <B> unload <I> the <B> latter <I> . <O>
but <O> it <B> could <B> be <I> much <B> worse <I> . <O>
some <B> analysts <I> are <B> especially <B> wary <I> of <B> credit-card <B> issues <I> . <O>
for <B> one <B> thing <I> , <O> credit-card <B> loans <I> are <B> unsecured <B> . <O>
in <B> addition <B> , <O> they <B> fear <B> that <B> banks <B> have <B> been <I> overeager <B> to <B> issue <I> cards <B> to <B> the <B> public <I> -- <O> giving <B> cards <B> to <B> too <B> many <I> big <I> spenders <I> who <B> will <B> default <I> during <B> a <B> recession <I> . <O>
`` <O> a <B> day <I> of <B> reckoning <B> is <B> coming <I> where <B> we <B> think <B> the <B> market <I> will <B> place <I> a <B> high <I> premium <I> on <B> the <B> highest-quality <I> debt <I> issues <I> , <O> and <O> therefore <B> we <B> think <B> the <B> best <I> debt <I> investment <I> is <B> u.s. <B> government <I> bonds <I> , <O> '' <O> says <B> craig <B> corcoran <I> of <B> davis\/zweig <B> futures <I> inc. <I> , <O> an <B> investment <I> advisory <I> firm <I> . <O>
what <B> about <B> triple-a-rated <B> asset-backed <I> issues <I> ? <O>
`` <O> nope <B> , <O> we <B> still <B> say <B> to <I> stick <I> with <B> treasurys <B> , <O> '' <O> mr. <B> corcoran <I> replies <B> . <O>
ratings <B> , <O> he <B> notes <B> , <O> `` <O> are <B> subject <B> to <B> change <B> . <O> '' <O>
all <B> this <I> makes <B> asset-backed <B> securities <I> seem <B> too <B> risky <I> for <B> many <B> people <I> . <O>
and <O> it <B> reminds <B> raymond <B> f. <I> devoe <I> jr. <I> , <O> a <B> market <I> strategist <I> at <B> legg <B> mason <I> wood <I> walker <I> inc. <I> , <O> of <B> what <B> he <B> calls <B> `` <O> devoe <B> 's <B> unprovable <B> but <O> highly <B> probable <I> theory <B> no. <I> 1 <I> : <O>
`` <O> more <B> money <I> has <B> been <I> lost <I> reaching <B> for <B> yield <B> than <B> in <B> all <B> the <I> stock <I> speculations <I> , <I> scams <I> and <I> frauds <I> of <B> all <B> time <I> . <O> '' <O>
mr. <B> herman <I> is <B> a <B> staff <I> reporter <I> in <B> the <B> wall <I> street <I> journal <I> 's <B> new <I> york <I> bureau <I> . <O>

if <B> you <B> force <B> financial <B> planners <I> to <B> sum <I> up <B> their <B> most <I> important <I> advice <I> in <B> a <B> single <I> sentence <I> , <O> it <B> would <B> probably <I> be <I> a <B> one-word <I> sentence <I> : <O> diversify <B> . <O>
judging <B> by <B> a <B> poll <I> of <B> wall <B> street <I> journal <I> readers <I> conducted <B> this <B> summer <I> by <B> erdos <B> & <I> morgan <I> inc. <I> , <O> serious <B> investors <I> have <B> taken <I> that <B> advice <I> to <B> heart <B> . <O>
nearly <B> 1,000 <I> investors <I> responded <B> to <B> the <B> journal <I> 's <B> poll <I> , <O> providing <B> an <B> in-depth <I> look <I> at <B> their <B> portfolios <I> . <O>
those <B> portfolios <I> are <B> remarkably <B> diversified <I> . <O>
by <B> spreading <B> their <B> wealth <I> among <B> several <B> investment <I> alternatives <I> , <O> the <B> respondents <I> have <B> protected <I> themselves <B> against <B> squalls <B> in <B> any <B> one <I> area <I> , <O> be <O> it <B> stocks <B> , <O> bonds <B> or <O> real <B> estate <I> . <O>
for <B> example <B> , <O> about <B> 88 <I> % <I> of <B> journal <B> readers <I> owned <B> stock <B> -lrb- <O> down <B> slightly <B> from <B> 91 <B> % <I> in <B> a <B> similar <I> poll <I> last <B> year <I> -rrb- <O> . <O>
but <O> only <B> 17.5 <I> % <I> said <B> they <B> had <B> more <B> than <I> half <I> their <I> money <I> in <B> the <B> stock <I> market <I> . <O>
similarly <B> , <O> 57 <B> % <I> of <B> respondents <B> own <B> shares <B> in <B> a <B> money-market <I> mutual <I> fund <I> , <O> and <O> 33 <B> % <I> own <B> municipal <B> bonds <I> . <O>
but <O> only <B> 6 <I> % <I> to <I> 7 <I> % <I> of <B> the <B> investors <I> were <B> committing <I> more <B> than <I> half <I> their <I> funds <I> to <B> either <B> of <B> those <B> alternatives <I> . <O>
the <B> poll <I> , <O> conducted <B> aug. <B> 7-28 <I> , <O> also <B> provides <B> a <B> glimpse <I> into <B> the <B> thinking <I> of <B> serious <B> investors <I> on <B> a <B> variety <I> of <B> other <B> topics <I> . <O>
it <B> found <B> them <B> in <B> a <B> cautious <I> , <I> but <I> not <I> downbeat <I> , <I> mood <I> . <O>
of <B> 1,500 <B> people <I> sent <B> a <B> questionnaire <I> , <O> 951 <B> replied <B> . <O>
the <B> response <I> rate <I> , <O> more <B> than <I> 63 <I> % <I> , <O> allows <B> the <B> results <I> to <B> be <I> interpreted <I> with <B> a <B> high <I> degree <I> of <B> confidence <B> . <O>
the <B> results <I> ca <B> n't <I> be <I> extrapolated <I> to <B> all <B> investors <I> , <O> though <B> . <O>

but <O> it <B> fell <B> to <B> 1.8470 <B> marks <I> from <B> 1.8485 <B> . <O>

in <B> only <B> one <I> presidential <I> election <I> year <I> prior <B> to <B> 1948 <B> did <O> more <B> than <I> 20 <I> % <I> of <B> the <B> nation <I> 's <B> congressional <I> districts <I> choose <B> a <B> different <I> party <I> 's <B> candidate <I> for <B> the <B> white <I> house <I> than <B> for <B> the <B> house <I> of <B> representatives <B> . <O>
now <B> that <B> percentage <I> routinely <B> equals <I> a <B> third <I> and <O> twice <B> has <I> been <I> above <B> 40 <B> % <I> . <O>
as <B> we <B> know <B> , <O> voters <B> tend <B> to <I> favor <I> republicans <B> more <B> in <B> races <B> for <B> president <B> than <B> in <B> those <B> for <B> congress <B> . <O>
in <B> every <B> presidential <I> election <I> over <B> the <B> past <I> half <I> century <I> , <O> except <B> for <B> the <B> goldwater <I> presidential <I> candidacy <I> , <O> the <B> gop <I> has <B> captured <I> a <B> greater <I> percentage <I> of <B> the <B> major-party <I> popular <I> vote <I> for <B> president <B> than <B> it <B> has <B> of <B> congressional <B> seats <I> or <O> the <B> popular <I> vote <I> for <B> congress <B> . <O>
prior <B> to <B> 1932 <B> , <O> the <B> pattern <I> was <B> nearly <B> the <B> opposite <I> . <O>
what <B> accounts <B> for <B> the <B> results <I> of <B> recent <B> decades <I> ? <O>
a <B> simple <I> economic <I> theory <I> may <B> provide <I> at <B> least <I> a <B> partial <I> explanation <I> for <B> the <B> split <I> personality <I> displayed <B> by <B> americans <B> in <B> the <B> voting <I> booth <I> . <O>
the <B> theory <I> relies <B> on <B> three <B> assumptions <I> : <O>
1 <B> -rrb- <O> voters <B> can <B> `` <I> buy <I> '' <O> one <B> of <B> two <B> brands <I> when <B> they <B> select <B> their <B> political <I> agents <I> -- <O> a <B> republican <I> brand <I> that <B> believes <B> in <B> the <B> minimalist <I> state <I> and <B> in <B> the <B> virtues <I> of <B> private <B> markets <I> over <B> the <B> vices <I> of <B> public <B> action <I> , <O> and <O> a <B> democratic <I> brand <I> that <B> believes <B> in <B> big <B> government <I> and <B> in <B> public <B> intervention <I> to <B> remedy <I> the <B> excesses <I> attendant <B> to <B> the <B> pursuit <I> of <B> private <B> interest <I> . <O>
2 <B> -rrb- <O> congressional <B> representatives <I> have <B> two <B> basic <I> responsibilities <I> while <B> voting <B> in <B> office <B> -- <O> dealing <B> with <B> national <B> issues <I> -lrb- <O> programmatic <B> actions <I> such <B> as <I> casting <B> roll <B> call <I> votes <I> on <B> legislation <B> that <B> imposes <B> costs <B> and\/or <O> confers <B> benefits <B> on <B> the <B> population <I> at <B> large <B> -rrb- <O> and <O> attending <B> to <B> local <B> issues <I> -lrb- <O> constituency <B> service <I> and <O> pork <B> barrel <I> -rrb- <O> . <O>
3 <B> -rrb- <O> republican <B> congressional <I> representatives <I> , <O> because <B> of <I> their <B> belief <I> in <B> a <B> minimalist <I> state <I> , <O> are <B> less <B> willing <I> to <B> engage <I> in <B> local <B> benefit-seeking <I> than <B> are <O> democratic <B> members <I> of <B> congress <B> . <O>
if <B> these <B> assumptions <I> hold <B> , <O> voters <B> in <B> races <B> for <B> congress <B> face <B> what <B> in <B> economic <B> theory <I> is <B> called <I> a <B> prisoner <I> 's <B> dilemma <I> and <O> have <B> an <B> incentive <I> , <O> at <B> the <B> margin <I> , <O> to <B> lean <I> democratic <B> . <O>
if <B> they <B> put <B> a <B> republican <I> into <B> office <B> , <O> not <B> only <I> will <O> they <B> acquire <B> less <B> in <B> terms <B> of <B> local <B> benefits <I> but <O> their <B> selected <I> legislator <I> will <B> be <I> relatively <B> powerless <I> to <B> prevent <I> other <B> legislators <I> from <B> `` <O> bringing <B> home <B> the <B> bacon <I> '' <O> to <B> their <B> respective <I> constituencies <I> . <O>
each <B> legislator <I> , <O> after <B> all <B> , <O> is <B> only <B> one <I> out <B> of <B> 535 <B> when <B> it <B> comes <B> to <B> national <B> policy <I> making <I> . <O>
in <B> races <B> for <B> the <B> white <I> house <I> , <O> a <B> voter <I> 's <B> incentive <I> , <O> at <B> the <B> margin <I> , <O> is <B> to <B> lean <I> republican <B> . <O>
although <B> a <B> gop <I> president <I> may <B> limit <I> local <B> benefits <I> to <B> the <B> voter <I> 's <B> particular <I> district\/state <I> , <O> such <B> a <I> president <I> is <B> also <B> likely <B> to <B> be <I> more <B> effective <I> at <B> preventing <B> other <B> districts\/states <I> and <O> their <B> legislators <I> from <B> bringing <B> home <B> the <B> local <I> benefits <I> . <O>
the <B> individual <I> voter <I> 's <I> standing <B> consequently <B> will <B> be <I> enhanced <I> through <B> lower <B> taxes <I> . <O>
while <B> this <B> theory <I> is <B> exceedingly <B> simple <I> , <O> it <B> appears <B> to <I> explain <I> several <B> things <I> . <O>
first <B> , <O> why <B> ticket <B> splitting <I> has <B> increased <I> and <O> taken <B> the <B> peculiar <I> pattern <I> that <B> it <B> has <B> over <B> the <B> past <I> half <I> century <I> : <O> prior <B> to <B> the <B> election <I> of <B> franklin <B> roosevelt <I> as <B> president <B> and <O> the <B> advent <I> of <B> the <B> new <I> deal <I> , <O> government <B> occupied <B> a <B> much <I> smaller <I> role <I> in <B> society <B> and <O> the <B> prisoner <I> 's <B> dilemma <I> problem <I> confronting <B> voters <B> in <B> races <B> for <B> congress <B> was <B> considerably <B> less <I> severe <I> . <O>
second <B> , <O> it <B> explains <B> why <B> voters <B> hold <B> congress <B> in <B> disdain <B> but <O> generally <B> love <I> their <B> own <I> congressional <I> representatives <I> : <O> any <B> individual <I> legislator <I> 's <B> constituents <I> appreciate <B> the <B> specific <I> benefits <I> that <B> the <B> legislator <I> wins <B> for <B> them <B> but <B> not <I> the <B> overall <I> cost <I> associated <B> with <B> every <B> other <I> legislator <I> doing <B> likewise <B> for <B> his <B> own <I> constituency <I> . <O>
third <B> , <O> the <B> theory <I> suggests <B> why <B> legislators <B> who <B> pay <B> too <B> much <I> attention <I> to <B> national <B> policy <I> making <I> relative <B> to <B> local <B> benefit-seeking <I> have <B> lower <B> security <I> in <B> office <B> . <O>
for <B> example <B> , <O> first-term <B> members <I> of <B> the <B> house <I> , <O> once <B> the <B> most <I> vulnerable <I> of <B> incumbents <B> , <O> have <B> become <I> virtually <B> immune <I> to <B> defeat <B> . <O>
the <B> one <I> exception <I> to <B> this <B> recent <I> trend <I> was <B> the <B> defeat <I> of <B> 13 <B> of <B> the <B> 52 <I> freshman <I> republicans <I> brought <B> into <B> office <B> in <B> 1980 <B> by <B> the <B> reagan <I> revolution <I> and <O> running <B> for <B> re-election <B> in <B> 1982 <B> . <O>
because <B> these <B> freshmen <I> placed <B> far <B> more <I> emphasis <I> on <B> their <B> partisan <I> role <I> -- <O> spreading <B> the <B> reagan <I> revolution <I> -- <O> in <B> national <B> policy <I> making <I> , <O> they <B> were <B> more <B> vulnerable <I> to <B> defeat <B> . <O>
fourth <B> , <O> the <B> theory <I> indicates <B> why <B> the <B> republican <I> party <I> may <B> have <I> a <B> difficult <I> time <I> attracting <B> viable <B> candidates <I> for <B> congressional <B> office <I> . <O>
potential <B> candidates <I> may <B> be <I> discouraged <I> from <B> running <B> less <B> by <B> the <B> congressional <I> salary <I> than <B> by <B> the <B> prospect <I> of <B> defeat <B> at <B> the <B> hands <I> of <B> a <B> democratic <I> opponent <I> . <O>

the <B> proposal <I> would <B> restore <I> some <B> discipline <I> erased <B> from <B> the <B> budget <I> process <I> by <B> the <B> 1974 <I> budget <I> `` <I> reform <I> '' <I> act <I> . <O>

`` <O> if <B> we <B> want <B> to <I> have <I> our <B> own <I> nation <I> , <O> then <B> we <B> must <B> be <I> willing <B> to <B> do <I> all <B> the <I> work <I> ourselves <B> , <O> '' <O> says <B> hendrik <B> verwoerd <I> jr. <I> , <O> son <B> of <B> the <B> former <I> prime <I> minister <I> and <O> the <B> leader <I> of <B> the <B> orange <I> workers <I> , <O> founded <B> in <B> 1980 <B> . <O>

the <B> pillars <I> of <B> apartheid <B> may <B> be <I> trembling <I> in <B> the <B> rest <I> of <B> south <B> africa <I> , <O> with <B> johannesburg <B> opening <B> its <B> public <I> facilities <I> to <B> all <B> races <I> , <O> blacks <B> storming <B> the <B> all-white <I> beaches <I> of <B> the <B> cape <I> and <O> the <B> government <I> releasing <B> seven <B> leaders <I> of <B> the <B> banned <I> african <I> national <I> congress <I> . <O>
but <O> here <B> in <B> morgenzon <B> , <O> a <B> sleepy <I> town <I> amid <B> the <B> corn <I> fields <I> of <B> the <B> eastern <I> transvaal <I> , <O> the <B> orange <I> workers <I> are <B> holding <I> the <B> pillars <I> steady <B> . <O>
the <B> orange <I> workers <I> -- <O> who <B> take <B> their <B> name <I> from <B> william <B> of <B> orange <B> of <B> the <B> netherlands <I> , <O> a <B> hero <I> of <B> the <B> dutch-descended <I> afrikaners <I> -- <O> believe <B> that <B> the <B> solution <I> to <B> south <B> africa <I> 's <B> racial <I> problems <I> is <B> n't <O> the <B> abolition <I> of <B> apartheid <B> , <O> it <B> 's <B> the <B> perfection <I> of <B> apartheid <B> -- <O> complete <B> and <I> total <I> separation <I> of <B> the <B> races <I> . <O>
here <B> , <O> then <B> , <O> is <B> where <B> the <B> orange <I> workers <I> have <B> come <I> to <B> make <I> apartheid <B> 's <B> last <I> stand <I> . <O>
their <B> idea <I> is <B> to <B> create <I> a <B> city <I> , <O> first <B> , <O> and <O> then <O> an <B> entire <I> nation <I> -- <O> without <B> blacks <B> . <O>
this <B> may <B> seem <I> to <I> be <I> a <B> preposterous <I> and <I> utterly <I> futile <I> effort <I> in <B> africa <B> . <O>
and <O> the <B> fact <I> that <B> there <B> are <B> only <B> 3,000 <I> card-carrying <I> orange <I> workers <I> may <B> put <I> them <B> on <B> the <B> loony <I> fringe <I> . <O>
but <O> their <B> ideal <I> of <B> an <B> afrikaner <I> homeland <I> , <O> an <B> all-white <I> reserve <I> to <B> be <I> carved <I> out <B> of <B> present-day <B> south <I> africa <I> , <O> is <B> a <B> mainstream <I> desire <I> of <B> the <B> right-wing <I> , <O> which <B> embraces <B> about <B> one-third <I> of <B> the <B> country <I> 's <B> five <I> million <I> whites <I> . <O>
afrikaner <B> philosophers <I> and <I> theologians <I> have <B> long <I> ruminated <I> on <B> the <B> need <I> for <B> a <B> white <I> homeland <I> . <O>
the <B> orange <I> workers <I> are <B> just <I> putting <I> this <B> preaching <I> into <B> practice <B> . <O>
thus <B> , <O> farmer <B> johan <I> fischer <I> , <O> his <B> t-shirt <I> and <I> jeans <I> covered <B> in <B> grease <B> , <O> crawls <B> around <B> under <B> his <B> planter <I> , <O> tightening <B> bolts <B> and <O> fixing <B> dents <B> . <O>
on <B> almost <B> every <I> other <B> farm <I> in <B> south <B> africa <I> , <O> black <B> workers <I> do <B> the <B> repairs <I> . <O>
but <O> not <O> here <B> . <O>
mr. <B> fischer <I> plows <B> his <B> own <I> fields <I> , <O> sows <B> his <B> own <I> corn <I> and <I> sunflowers <I> , <O> and <O> feeds <B> his <B> own <I> sheep <I> . <O>

`` <O> we <B> must <B> either <I> integrate <I> honestly <B> or <O> segregate <B> honestly <B> . <O> '' <O>
morgenzon <B> has <B> long <I> been <I> a <B> special <I> domain <I> of <B> afrikanerdom <B> . <O>
according <B> to <B> mr. <B> verwoerd <I> , <O> the <B> early <I> afrikaner <I> pioneers <I> were <B> the <B> first <I> people <I> to <B> settle <I> in <B> the <B> eastern <I> transvaal <I> , <O> even <B> before <I> the <B> blacks <I> . <O>
then <O> , <O> when <B> morgenzon <B> was <B> incorporated <I> in <B> 1908 <B> , <O> the <B> farmer <I> who <B> owned <B> the <B> land <I> stipulated <B> that <B> only <B> whites <I> could <B> reside <I> in <B> town <B> ; <O> blacks <B> could <B> work <I> there <B> , <O> but <O> they <B> had <B> to <I> leave <I> at <B> night <B> . <O>

weeds <B> push <B> up <B> through <B> the <B> cracks <I> in <B> the <B> sidewalks <I> , <O> and <O> many <B> houses <I> and <I> storefronts <I> are <B> empty <B> . <O>

mr. <B> canelo <I> suggests <B> that <B> investors <B> compare <B> price\/earnings <B> ratios <I> -lrb- <O> the <B> price <I> of <B> a <B> share <I> of <B> stock <B> divided <B> by <B> a <B> company <I> 's <B> per-share <I> earnings <I> for <B> a <B> 12-month <I> period <I> -rrb- <O> with <B> projected <B> growth <I> rates <I> . <O>

the <B> 23-5 <I> vote <I> clears <B> the <B> way <I> for <B> consideration <B> on <B> the <B> house <I> floor <I> next <B> week <I> or <O> the <B> week <I> after <B> . <O>

the <B> stepped-up <I> administration <I> warnings <I> annoyed <B> some <B> lawmakers <I> , <O> especially <B> senior <I> republicans <I> who <B> supported <B> the <B> bill <I> because <B> they <B> thought <B> the <B> transportation <I> department <I> favored <B> it <B> . <O>
`` <O> we <B> backed <B> this <B> bill <I> because <B> we <B> thought <B> it <B> would <B> help <I> skinner <B> , <O> '' <O> one <B> republican <I> said <B> , <O> `` <O> and <O> now <B> we <B> 're <B> out <B> there <I> dangling <B> in <B> the <B> wind <I> . <O> '' <O>
a <B> few <I> weeks <I> ago <B> , <O> mr. <B> skinner <I> testified <B> before <B> congress <B> that <B> it <B> would <B> be <I> `` <O> cleaner <B> , <O> more <B> efficient <I> '' <O> if <B> he <B> had <B> authority <B> to <B> block <I> buy-outs <B> in <B> advance <B> . <O>

under <B> the <B> committee <I> bill <I> , <O> the <B> transportation <I> secretary <I> would <B> have <I> 30 <B> days <I> , <O> and <O> an <B> additional <I> 20 <I> days <I> if <B> needed <B> , <O> to <B> review <I> any <B> proposed <I> purchase <I> of <B> 15 <B> % <I> or <I> more <I> of <B> a <B> major <I> u.s. <I> airline <I> 's <B> voting <I> stock <I> . <O>
the <B> secretary <I> would <B> be <I> required <I> to <I> block <I> an <B> acquisition <I> if <B> he <B> concluded <B> that <B> it <B> would <B> so <I> weaken <I> an <B> airline <I> financially <B> that <B> it <B> would <B> hurt <I> safety <B> or <O> reduce <B> the <B> carrier <I> 's <B> ability <I> to <B> compete <I> , <O> or <O> if <B> it <B> gave <B> control <B> to <B> a <B> foreign <I> interest <I> . <O>
although <B> the <B> legislation <I> would <B> apply <I> to <B> any <B> acquisition <I> of <B> a <B> major <I> airline <I> , <O> it <B> is <B> aimed <I> at <B> transactions <B> financed <B> by <B> large <B> amounts <I> of <B> debt <B> . <O>

power <B> of <B> suggestion <B> stronger <B> in <B> japan <B>

corporate <B> efforts <I> to <B> control <I> health-care <B> costs <I> by <B> requiring <B> evaluations <B> prior <B> to <I> planned <B> hospitalization <I> and <I> surgery <I> have <B> n't <I> been <I> sweeping <B> enough <I> to <B> reduce <I> the <B> long-term <I> rate <I> of <B> cost <B> increases <I> , <O> according <B> to <B> a <B> study <I> by <B> the <B> institute <I> of <B> medicine <B> . <O>

these <B> programs <I> vary <B> widely <B> , <O> but <O> often <B> require <I> second <B> opinions <I> on <B> proposed <B> surgery <I> , <O> preadmission <B> reviews <I> of <B> elective <B> hospitalizations <I> and <O> reviews <B> of <B> treatment <B> during <B> illnesses <B> or <O> recovery <B> periods <I> . <O>
between <B> 50 <I> % <I> and <I> 75 <I> % <I> of <B> today <B> 's <B> workers <I> are <B> covered <I> by <B> such <B> plans <I> , <O> up <B> from <B> 5 <B> % <I> five <B> years <I> ago <B> . <O>
`` <O> although <B> it <B> probably <B> has <B> reduced <I> the <B> level <I> of <B> expenditures <B> for <B> some <B> purchasers <I> , <O> utilization <B> management <I> -- <O> like <B> most <B> other <I> cost <I> containment <I> strategies <I> -- <O> does <B> n't <I> appear <I> to <I> have <I> altered <I> the <B> long-term <I> rate <I> of <B> increase <B> in <B> health-care <B> costs <I> , <O> '' <O> the <B> institute <I> of <B> medicine <B> , <O> an <B> affiliate <I> of <B> the <B> national <I> academy <I> of <B> sciences <B> , <O> concluded <B> after <B> a <B> two-year <I> study <I> . <O>
`` <O> employers <B> who <B> saw <B> a <B> short-term <I> moderation <I> in <B> benefit <B> expenditures <I> are <B> seeing <I> a <B> return <I> to <B> previous <B> trends <I> . <O> '' <O>
while <B> utilization <B> management <I> frequently <B> reduces <B> hospitalization <B> costs <I> , <O> these <B> savings <I> are <B> often <I> offset <I> by <B> increases <B> in <B> outpatient <B> services <I> and <O> higher <B> administrative <I> costs <I> , <O> according <B> to <B> the <B> report <I> by <B> a <B> panel <I> of <B> health-care <B> experts <I> . <O>
the <B> report <I> suggested <B> that <O> current <B> review <I> programs <I> are <B> too <B> narrow <I> . <O>
`` <O> the <B> unnecessary <I> and <I> inappropriate <I> use <I> of <B> the <B> hospital <I> , <B> and <I> not <I> the <B> actual <I> need <I> for <B> a <B> particular <I> procedure <I> , <O> has <B> been <I> the <B> main <I> focus <I> , <O> '' <O> the <B> panel <I> said <B> . <O>
`` <O> as <B> a <B> general <I> rule <I> , <O> prior-review <B> programs <I> have <B> not <I> made <I> case-by-case <B> assessments <I> of <B> the <B> comparative <I> costs <I> of <B> alternative <B> treatments <I> or <I> sites <I> of <B> care <B> . <O> '' <O>
the <B> report <I> said <B> that <O> utilization <B> management <I> should <B> have <I> more <B> of <B> an <B> impact <I> as <B> federal <B> research <I> on <B> the <B> effectiveness <I> of <B> medical <B> treatments <I> helps <B> lead <I> to <B> medical <B> practice <I> guidelines <I> . <O>
howard <B> bailit <I> , <O> a <B> panel <I> member <I> and <O> a <B> vice <I> president <I> of <B> aetna <B> life <I> & <I> casualty <I> , <O> said <B> that <O> utilization <B> management <I> will <B> also <I> do <I> a <B> better <I> job <I> of <B> containing <B> costs <B> as <B> it <B> spreads <B> to <I> cover <I> medical <B> services <I> delivered <B> outside <B> of <B> hospitals <B> . <O>
`` <O> there <B> 's <B> pretty <B> good <I> evidence <I> that <O> utilization <B> management <I> has <B> reduced <I> inappropriate <B> hospitalization <I> , <O> '' <O> he <B> said <B> . <O>
but <O> at <B> the <B> same <I> time <I> , <O> spending <B> on <B> physician <B> services <I> and <O> ambulatory <B> care <I> have <B> mushroomed <I> . <O>
`` <O> it <B> 's <B> like <B> squeezing <B> a <B> balloon <I> , <O> '' <O> dr. <B> bailit <I> said <B> . <O>
david <B> rahill <I> of <B> a. <B> foster <I> higgins <I> & <I> co. <I> said <B> that <B> clients <B> of <B> his <B> consulting <I> firm <I> report <B> that <O> utilization <B> management <I> reduces <B> their <B> hospital <I> care <I> bills <I> by <B> about <B> 5 <I> % <I> , <O> but <O> he <B> agreed <B> that <B> for <B> the <B> health-care <I> system <I> as <B> whole <B> , <O> some <B> of <B> these <B> savings <I> are <B> offset <I> by <B> administrative <O> and <O> outpatient <B> care <I> costs <B> . <O>
jerome <B> grossman <I> , <O> chairman <B> of <B> the <B> panel <I> , <O> agrees <B> that <B> administrative <B> costs <I> of <B> utilization <B> management <I> programs <I> can <B> be <I> high <B> . <O>
`` <O> you <B> have <B> a <B> whole <I> staff <I> standing <B> ready <B> '' <O> to <B> evaluate <I> the <B> appropriateness <I> of <B> recommended <B> treatment <I> , <O> he <B> said <B> . <O>
dr. <B> grossman <I> , <O> who <B> also <B> is <B> president <B> of <B> new <B> england <I> medical <I> center <I> hospitals <I> in <B> boston <B> , <O> noted <B> that <B> the <B> hospitals <I> he <B> runs <B> deal <B> with <B> more <B> than <I> 100 <I> utilization <I> management <I> firms <I> and <O> that <B> many <B> of <B> them <B> have <B> different <B> procedures <I> and <I> requirements <I> . <O>
the <B> panel <I> urged <B> greater <B> efforts <I> to <B> reduce <I> the <B> complexity <I> , <I> paperwork <I> and <I> cost <I> of <B> utilization <B> review <I> . <O>
`` <O> utilization <B> management <I> needs <B> to <I> better <I> demonstrate <I> that <B> it <B> reduces <B> the <B> wasteful <I> use <I> of <B> resources <B> , <O> improves <B> the <B> appropriateness <I> of <B> patient <B> care <I> and <O> imposes <B> only <B> reasonable <B> burdens <I> on <B> patients <B> and <I> providers <I> , <O> '' <O> the <B> panel <I> concluded <B> . <O>
renault <B> and <O> daf <B> trucks <I> nv <I> announced <B> a <B> preliminary <I> agreement <I> to <B> jointly <I> manufacture <I> a <B> line <I> of <B> trucks <B> in <B> britain <B> and <I> france <I> . <O>
philippe <B> gras <I> , <O> a <B> renault <I> managing <I> director <I> , <O> said <B> the <B> new <I> line <I> will <B> cover <I> trucks <B> of <B> between <B> 2.5 <B> tons <I> and <O> 4.2 <B> tons <I> and <O> will <B> be <I> built <I> at <B> renault <B> 's <B> bapilly <I> plant <I> in <B> france <B> and <B> at <B> daf <B> 's <B> british <I> plant <I> . <O>
the <B> french <I> state-controlled <I> auto <I> group <I> and <O> the <B> dutch <I> truck <I> maker <I> plan <B> to <I> incorporate <I> the <B> new <I> trucks <I> into <B> their <B> product <I> lines <I> when <B> they <B> begin <B> production <B> toward <B> the <B> middle <I> of <B> the <B> 1990s <I> . <O>
mr. <B> gras <I> said <B> he <B> expects <B> a <B> definitive <I> agreement <I> between <B> the <B> two <I> companies <I> to <B> be <I> completed <I> in <B> the <B> next <I> few <I> months <I> . <O>
the <B> venture <I> is <B> the <B> latest <I> example <I> of <B> the <B> trend <I> toward <B> cooperative <B> projects <I> in <B> europe <B> ahead <B> of <B> the <B> 1992 <I> deadline <I> for <B> eliminating <B> trade <B> barriers <I> within <B> the <B> european <I> community <I> . <O>
renault <B> and <I> daf <I> are <B> expected <I> to <I> invest <I> a <B> total <I> of <B> about <B> three <I> billion <I> french <I> francs <I> -lrb- <O> $ <B> 157.8 <I> million <I> -rrb- <O> in <B> the <B> venture <I> , <O> including <B> ffr <B> 1 <I> billion <I> for <B> design <B> and <I> development <I> costs <I> . <O>
in <B> addition <B> , <O> the <B> companies <I> will <B> each <O> spend <B> about <B> ffr <I> 1 <I> billion <I> on <B> tooling <B> up <B> their <B> plants <I> . <O>
mr. <B> gras <I> said <B> the <B> joint <I> venture <I> represents <B> considerable <B> savings <I> for <B> both <B> renault <I> and <I> daf <I> , <O> since <B> both <B> companies <I> would <B> in <B> any <B> case <I> have <B> had <I> to <I> renew <I> their <B> existing <I> ranges <I> of <B> light <B> goods <I> vehicles <I> . <O>
by <B> pooling <B> their <B> resources <I> , <O> the <B> two <I> groups <I> have <B> effectively <I> halved <I> the <B> design <I> and <I> development <I> costs <I> that <B> would <B> otherwise <I> have <I> been <I> entailed <I> , <O> he <B> said <B> . <O>
renault <B> officials <I> said <B> the <B> potential <I> european <I> market <I> for <B> light <B> trucks <I> in <B> the <B> 2.5-ton <I> to <I> 4.2-ton <I> range <I> is <B> between <B> 700,000 <I> and <I> 800,000 <I> vehicles <I> annually <B> , <O> and <O> renault <B> and <I> daf <I> are <B> aiming <I> for <B> a <B> combined <I> market <I> share <I> of <B> about <B> 11 <I> % <I> . <O>
both <B> renault <I> and <I> daf <I> will <B> have <I> world-wide <B> marketing <I> rights <I> for <B> the <B> new <I> range <I> of <B> vans <B> and <O> light <B> trucks <I> . <O>
under <B> a <B> separate <I> arrangement <I> , <O> british <B> aerospace <I> plc <I> 's <B> rover <I> group <I> plc <I> subsidiary <I> will <B> also <I> be <I> able <B> to <B> offer <I> the <B> vehicles <I> through <B> its <B> dealers <I> in <B> the <B> u.k. <I> , <O> and <O> renault <B> 's <B> truck-building <I> subsidiary <I> renault <I> vehicles <I> industriels <I> will <B> have <I> similar <B> rights <I> in <B> france <B> . <O>
daf <B> is <B> 16%-owned <B> by <B> british <B> aerospace <I> , <O> with <B> a <B> further <I> 6.5 <I> % <I> held <B> by <B> the <B> dutch <I> state-owned <I> chemical <I> group <I> nv <B> dsm <I> . <O>
the <B> van <I> doorne <I> family <I> of <B> the <B> netherlands <I> holds <B> an <B> additional <I> 11 <I> % <I> of <B> daf <B> 's <B> capital <I> . <O>
the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> system <I> is <B> the <B> standard <I> object <I> of <B> suggestions <B> for <B> organizational <B> and <I> institutional <I> changes <I> , <O> for <B> two <B> reasons <I> . <O>
first <B> , <O> its <B> position <I> in <B> the <B> government <I> is <B> anomalous <B> . <O>
it <B> has <B> an <B> unusual <I> kind <I> of <B> independence <B> from <B> elected <B> officials <I> and <O> still <B> has <I> authority <B> over <B> one <B> of <B> the <B> most <I> powerful <I> of <B> government <B> 's <B> instruments <I> -- <O> the <B> control <I> of <B> the <B> money <I> supply <I> . <O>
thus <B> we <B> have <B> a <B> condition <I> that <B> is <B> easily <I> described <I> as <B> undemocratic <B> . <O>
second <B> , <O> the <B> responsibilities <I> of <B> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> as <B> guardian <B> of <B> the <B> currency <I> , <O> which <B> means <B> as <B> guardian <B> of <B> the <B> stability <I> of <B> the <B> price <I> level <I> , <O> sometimes <B> lead <B> it <B> to <B> take <I> measures <B> that <B> are <B> unpopular <B> . <O>
as <B> former <B> fed <I> chairman <I> william <I> mcchesney <I> martin <I> used <B> to <I> say <I> , <O> they <B> would <B> have <I> to <I> take <I> the <B> punch <I> bowl <I> away <B> just <B> as <B> the <B> party <I> is <B> getting <I> interesting <B> . <O>
so <O> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> is <B> an <B> attractive <I> target <I> for <B> complaint <B> by <B> politicians <B> . <O>
the <B> fed <I> is <B> easily <I> assigned <I> the <B> blame <I> for <B> unpleasantness <B> , <O> like <B> high <B> interest <I> rates <I> or <O> slow <B> economic <I> growth <I> , <O> while <B> the <B> politicians <I> can <B> escape <I> responsibility <B> by <B> pointing <B> to <B> the <B> fed <I> 's <B> independence <I> . <O>
this <B> leads <B> to <B> proposals <B> for <B> `` <O> reform <B> '' <O> of <B> the <B> fed <I> , <O> which <B> have <B> the <B> common <I> feature <I> of <B> making <B> the <B> fed <I> more <B> responsive <I> to <B> the <B> administration <I> , <O> to <B> the <B> congress <I> and <B> to <B> public <B> opinion <I> -- <O> without <B> , <O> however <B> , <O> any <B> assumption <I> of <B> additional <B> responsibility <I> by <B> the <B> politicians <I> . <O>
these <B> proposals <I> include <B> changing <I> the <B> term <I> of <B> the <B> chairman <I> , <O> shortening <B> the <B> terms <I> of <B> the <B> members <I> , <O> eliminating <B> the <B> presidents <I> of <B> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> banks <I> from <B> the <B> decision-making <I> process <I> , <O> putting <B> the <B> secretary <I> of <B> the <B> treasury <I> on <B> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> board <I> , <O> having <B> the <B> fed <I> audited <B> by <B> an <B> arm <I> of <B> congress <B> -lrb- <O> the <B> general <I> accounting <I> office <I> -rrb- <O> , <O> putting <B> the <B> fed <I> 's <B> expenditures <I> in <B> the <B> budget <I> , <O> and <O> requiring <B> prompt <B> publication <I> of <B> the <B> fed <I> 's <B> minutes <I> . <O>
some <B> of <B> these <B> ideas <I> are <B> again <B> under <B> consideration <B> in <B> congress <B> . <O>
but <O> these <B> proposals <I> do <B> not <I> rest <I> on <B> a <B> view <I> of <B> what <B> the <B> fed <I> 's <B> problem <I> is <B> or <O> , <O> if <B> they <B> do <B> , <O> they <B> rest <B> on <B> an <B> incorrect <I> view <I> . <O>
they <B> would <B> not <I> solve <I> the <B> problem <I> ; <O> they <B> would <B> make <I> it <B> worse <B> . <O>
the <B> problem <I> is <B> not <O> that <B> the <B> fed <I> is <B> too <B> unresponsive <I> to <B> the <B> public <I> interest <I> . <O>
on <B> the <B> contrary <I> , <O> it <B> is <B> too <B> responsive <I> to <B> an <B> incorrect <I> view <I> of <B> the <B> public <I> interest <I> . <O>
the <B> price <I> level <I> in <B> the <B> u.s. <I> is <B> now <B> about <B> 4 <I> 1\/4 <I> times <I> as <I> high <I> as <B> it <B> was <B> 30 <B> years <I> ago <B> . <O>
on <B> average <B> , <O> something <B> that <B> cost <B> $ <B> 100 <I> 30 <B> years <I> ago <B> now <B> costs <B> $ <B> 425 <I> . <O>
or <O> , <O> a <B> wage <I> that <B> was <B> $ <B> 100 <I> 30 <B> years <I> ago <B> would <B> buy <I> only <B> $ <I> 23.53 <I> worth <I> of <B> stuff <B> today <B> . <O>
on <B> two <B> occasions <I> the <B> inflation <I> rate <I> rose <B> to <B> more <B> than <I> 10 <I> % <I> a <B> year <I> . <O>
in <B> each <B> case <I> the <B> ending <I> of <B> this <B> unsustainable <I> inflation <I> caused <B> a <B> severe <I> recession <I> -- <O> the <B> two <I> worst <I> of <B> the <B> postwar <I> period <I> . <O>
the <B> enormous <I> inflation <I> over <B> the <B> past <I> 30 <I> years <I> was <B> largely <B> due <I> to <B> monetary <B> policy <I> . <O>
at <B> least <I> , <O> it <B> would <B> not <I> have <I> happened <I> without <B> the <B> support <I> of <B> monetary <B> policy <I> that <B> provided <B> for <B> a <B> 10-fold <I> increase <I> in <B> the <B> money <I> supply <I> during <B> the <B> same <I> period <I> . <O>
and <O> that <B> increase <I> in <B> the <B> money <I> supply <I> would <B> not <I> have <I> happened <I> without <B> the <B> consent <I> of <B> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> . <O>
the <B> basic <I> problem <I> of <B> monetary <B> policy <I> , <O> to <B> which <B> reform <B> of <B> the <B> fed <I> should <B> be <I> addressed <I> , <O> is <B> to <B> prevent <I> a <B> recurrence <I> of <B> this <B> experience <I> . <O>
there <B> were <B> two <B> general <I> reasons <I> for <B> the <B> mistaken <I> monetary <I> policy <I> of <B> the <B> past <I> 30 <I> years <I> : <O>
1 <B> . <O> to <B> some <B> extent <I> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> shared <B> the <B> popular <I> but <I> incorrect <I> view <I> that <B> expansionary <B> monetary <I> policy <I> could <B> yield <I> a <B> net <I> improvement <I> in <B> employment <B> and <I> output <I> . <O>
2 <B> . <O> even <B> where <I> the <B> fed <I> did <B> not <I> share <I> this <B> view <I> it <B> felt <B> the <B> need <I> to <B> accommodate <I> to <B> it <B> . <O>
despite <B> all <B> the <I> formal <I> provisions <I> for <B> its <B> independence <I> , <O> the <B> fed <I> seems <B> constantly <I> to <I> feel <I> that <B> if <B> it <B> uses <B> its <B> independence <I> too <B> freely <I> it <B> will <B> lose <I> it <B> . <O>
the <B> common <I> proposals <I> for <B> reforming <B> the <B> fed <I> would <B> only <I> make <I> the <B> situation <I> worse <B> , <O> if <B> they <B> had <B> any <B> effect <I> at <B> all <I> . <O>
putting <B> the <B> secretary <I> of <B> the <B> treasury <I> on <B> the <B> board <I> of <B> governors <B> , <O> one <B> of <B> the <B> leading <I> proposals <I> today <B> , <O> is <B> an <B> example <I> . <O>
the <B> secretary <I> is <B> the <B> world <I> 's <B> biggest <I> borrower <I> of <B> money <B> . <O>
he <B> has <B> a <B> built-in <I> , <I> constant <I> longing <I> for <B> lower <B> interest <I> rates <I> . <O>
moreover <B> , <O> he <B> is <B> a <B> political <I> agent <I> of <B> a <B> political <I> president <I> , <O> who <B> naturally <B> gives <I> extraordinary <B> weight <I> to <B> the <B> way <I> the <B> economy <I> will <B> perform <I> before <B> the <B> next <I> election <I> , <O> and <O> less <B> to <B> its <B> longer-run <I> health <I> . <O>
these <B> days <I> , <O> the <B> secretary <I> suffers <B> the <B> further <I> disqualification <I> that <B> he <B> is <B> a <B> member <I> of <B> a <B> club <I> of <B> seven <B> finance <I> ministers <I> who <B> meet <B> occasionally <B> to <B> decide <I> what <B> exchange <B> rates <I> should <B> be <I> , <O> which <B> is <B> a <B> diversion <I> from <B> the <B> real <I> business <I> of <B> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> to <B> stabilize <I> the <B> price <I> level <I> . <O>
how <B> should <O> a <B> reasonable <I> member <I> of <B> the <B> federal <I> reserve <I> board <I> interpret <B> a <B> congressional <I> decision <I> to <B> put <I> the <B> secretary <I> on <B> the <B> board <I> ? <O>
could <O> he <B> plausibly <B> interpret <B> it <B> as <B> encouragement <B> for <B> the <B> fed <I> to <B> give <I> primary <B> emphasis <I> to <B> stabilizing <B> the <B> price <I> level <I> ? <O>
or <O> would <O> he <B> interpret <B> it <B> as <B> instruction <B> to <B> give <I> more <B> weight <I> to <B> these <B> other <I> objectives <I> that <B> the <B> secretary <I> represents <B> -- <O> low <B> interest <I> rates <I> , <O> short-run <B> economic <I> expansion <I> , <O> and <O> stabilization <B> of <B> exchange <B> rates <I> at <B> internationally <B> managed <I> levels <I> ? <O>
the <B> answer <I> seems <B> perfectly <B> clear <I> . <O>

the <B> national <I> taxpayers <I> union <I> would <B> like <I> congress <B> to <B> add <I> 800,000 <B> acres <I> to <B> the <B> 453,000 <I> of <B> shoreline <B> in <B> the <B> system <I> by <B> enacting <B> `` <O> the <B> coastal <I> barrier <I> improvement <I> act <I> of <B> 1989 <B> . <O> '' <O>
this <B> bill <I> simply <B> says <B> that <B> if <B> you <B> want <B> to <I> develop <I> property <B> on <B> a <B> barrier <I> island <I> you <B> have <B> to <I> do <I> so <B> without <B> taxpayer <B> support <I> . <O>

however <B> , <O> home <B> builders <I> would <B> have <I> to <I> bear <I> the <B> full <I> costs <I> of <B> such <B> beach-house <I> construction <I> . <O>

marshall <B> y. <I> taylor <I>
communications <B> director <I>
national <B> taxpayers <I> union <I>
the <B> government <I> said <B> 13.1 <B> % <I> of <B> americans <B> , <O> or <O> 31.9 <B> million <I> people <I> , <O> were <B> living <I> in <B> poverty <B> in <B> 1988 <B> . <O>
while <B> last <B> year <I> 's <B> figure <I> was <B> down <B> from <B> 13.4 <B> % <I> in <B> 1987 <B> and <O> marked <B> the <B> fifth <I> consecutive <I> annual <I> decline <I> in <B> the <B> poverty <I> rate <I> , <O> the <B> census <I> bureau <I> said <B> the <B> 1988 <I> drop <I> was <B> n't <O> statistically <B> significant <I> . <O>
the <B> bureau <I> 's <B> report <I> also <B> showed <B> that <B> while <B> some <B> measures <I> of <B> the <B> nation <I> 's <B> economic <I> well-being <I> improved <B> modestly <B> in <B> 1988 <B> , <O> the <B> fruits <I> of <B> prosperity <B> were <B> shared <I> less <B> equitably <I> than <B> the <B> year <I> before <B> . <O>

but <O> , <O> he <B> added <B> , <O> `` <O> since <B> the <B> late <I> 1960s <I> , <O> the <B> distribution <I> of <B> income <B> has <B> been <I> slowly <I> getting <I> less <B> equal <I> . <O>
there <B> was <B> no <B> reversal <I> -lcb- <O> of <B> that <B> trend <I> -rcb- <O> between <B> 1987 <B> and <I> 1988 <I> . <O> '' <O>
per <B> capita <I> income <I> , <O> a <B> widely <I> used <I> measure <I> of <B> a <B> nation <I> 's <B> economic <I> health <I> , <O> hit <B> a <B> record <I> in <B> 1988 <B> , <O> rising <B> 1.7 <B> % <I> after <B> inflation <B> adjustment <I> to <B> $ <B> 13,120 <I> . <O>
but <O> the <B> median <I> income <I> of <B> american <B> families <I> fell <B> 0.2 <B> % <I> , <O> the <B> first <I> time <I> it <B> has <B> failed <I> to <I> rise <I> since <B> 1982 <B> . <O>
mr. <B> butz <I> said <B> the <B> divergence <I> in <B> the <B> two <I> measures <I> reflects <B> changes <B> in <B> family <B> size <I> and <I> structure <I> , <O> including <B> the <B> rising <I> number <I> of <B> female-headed <B> families <I> and <O> a <B> sharp <I> increase <I> in <B> income <B> reported <B> by <B> americans <B> who <B> are <B> n't <I> living <I> in <B> families <B> . <O>
as <B> a <B> result <I> of <B> last <B> year <I> 's <B> decline <I> , <O> the <B> government <I> 's <B> estimate <I> for <B> the <B> number <I> of <B> people <B> living <B> below <B> the <B> poverty <I> line <I> declined <B> by <B> about <B> 500,000 <I> . <O>
the <B> poverty <I> threshold <I> , <O> defined <B> as <B> three <B> times <I> food <B> expenses <I> as <B> calculated <B> by <B> the <B> agricultural <I> department <I> , <O> last <B> year <I> was <B> $ <B> 12,092 <I> for <B> a <B> family <I> of <B> four <B> . <O>
the <B> census <I> bureau <I> counts <B> all <B> cash <I> income <I> in <B> determining <B> whether <B> families <B> are <B> below <B> the <B> line <I> , <O> but <O> it <B> does <B> n't <I> consider <I> other <B> government <I> benefits <I> , <O> such <B> as <I> medicare <B> . <O>

in <B> 1988 <B> , <O> 31.6 <B> % <I> of <B> blacks <B> lived <B> in <B> poverty <B> , <O> compared <B> with <B> 10.1 <B> % <I> for <B> whites <B> and <O> 26.8 <B> % <I> for <B> hispanics <B> . <O>

convertible <B> mortgages <I> have <B> become <I> an <B> increasingly <I> popular <I> way <I> to <B> finance <I> prestigious <B> buildings <I> of <B> late <B> . <O>
in <B> a <B> convertible <I> mortgage <I> , <O> the <B> investor <I> lends <B> the <B> building <I> owner <I> a <B> certain <I> amount <I> in <B> return <B> for <B> the <B> option <I> to <B> convert <I> its <B> interest <I> into <B> equity <B> , <O> usually <B> less <B> than <I> 50 <I> % <I> , <O> at <B> the <B> end <I> of <B> the <B> loan <I> term <I> . <O>
during <B> the <B> term <I> , <O> the <B> lender <I> can <B> either <I> receive <I> a <B> percentage <I> of <B> cash <B> flow <I> , <O> a <B> percentage <I> of <B> the <B> building <I> 's <B> appreciation <I> or <O> a <B> fixed <I> return <I> . <O>
the <B> main <I> advantage <I> of <B> a <B> convertible <I> mortgage <I> is <B> that <B> it <B> is <B> not <O> a <B> sale <I> and <O> therefore <B> does <B> not <I> trigger <I> costly <B> transfer <I> taxes <I> and <I> reappraisal <I> . <O>

but <O> of <B> course <B> the <B> market <I> could <B> decide <I> that <B> the <B> firm <I> 's <B> capital <I> stock <I> -- <O> its <B> assets <I> -- <O> means <B> nothing <B> if <B> the <B> firm <I> is <B> not <I> producing <I> profits <B> . <O>

what <B> is <B> the <B> consequence <I> of <B> a <B> high-interest <I> burden <I> , <O> high <B> default <I> rates <I> and <O> continued <B> low <I> profitability <I> ? <O>

the <B> consequence <I> can <B> be <I> inflation <B> , <O> brought <B> on <B> as <B> the <B> effect <I> of <B> a <B> desperate <I> bid <I> to <B> avoid <I> the <B> deflationary <I> shock <I> of <B> a <B> sudden <I> crash <I> . <O>

part <B> of <B> a <B> series <I> -rcb- <O>

some <B> people <I> argue <B> that <B> strong <B> brands <I> can <B> afford <I> to <I> stop <I> advertising <I> for <B> a <B> time <I> because <B> of <I> the <B> residual <I> impact <I> of <B> hundreds <B> of <B> millions <B> of <B> dollars <B> spent <B> on <B> advertising <B> through <B> the <B> years <I> . <O>

but <O> since <B> returning <B> to <B> advertising <B> , <O> maxwell <B> house <I> has <B> regained <I> the <B> lost <I> share <I> and <O> is <B> running <I> neck <B> and <I> neck <I> with <B> archrival <B> folgers <I> . <O>

campbell <B> soup <I> co. <I> , <O> for <B> one <B> , <O> has <B> concluded <I> that <B> it <B> makes <B> good <B> sense <I> to <B> focus <I> more <B> on <B> its <B> most <I> loyal <I> customers <I> than <B> on <B> people <B> who <B> buy <B> competitive <B> brands <I> . <O>

the <B> margin <I> of <B> error <B> for <B> subgroups <B> -- <O> for <B> example <B> , <O> married <B> women <I> with <B> children <B> at <B> home <B> -- <O> would <B> be <I> larger <B> . <O>

from <B> a <B> helicopter <I> a <B> thousand <I> feet <I> above <B> oakland <B> after <B> the <B> second-deadliest <I> earthquake <I> in <B> u.s. <B> history <I> , <O> a <B> scene <I> of <B> devastation <B> emerges <B> : <O> a <B> freeway <I> crumbled <B> into <B> a <B> concrete <I> sandwich <I> , <O> hoses <B> pumping <B> water <B> into <B> once-fashionable <B> apartments <I> , <O> abandoned <B> autos <I> . <O>
but <O> this <B> quake <I> was <B> n't <O> the <B> big <I> one <I> , <O> the <B> replay <I> of <B> 1906 <B> that <B> has <B> been <I> feared <I> for <B> so <B> many <I> years <I> . <O>
despite <B> the <B> tragic <I> loss <I> of <B> more <B> than <I> 270 <I> lives <I> , <O> and <O> damage <B> estimated <B> in <B> the <B> billions <I> , <O> most <B> businesses <I> and <O> their <B> plants <I> and <I> offices <I> in <B> the <B> bay <I> area <I> were <B> n't <I> greatly <I> affected <I> . <O>
the <B> economic <I> life <I> of <B> the <B> region <I> is <B> expected <I> to <I> revive <I> in <B> a <B> day <I> or <I> two <I> , <O> although <B> some <B> transportation <I> problems <I> may <B> last <I> weeks <B> or <I> months <I> . <O>
a <B> main <I> factor <I> mitigating <B> more <B> widespread <I> damage <I> was <B> the <B> location <I> of <B> the <B> quake <I> 's <B> epicenter <I> -- <O> 20 <B> miles <I> from <B> the <B> heart <I> of <B> the <B> silicon <I> valley <I> and <B> more <B> than <I> 50 <I> miles <I> from <B> downtown <B> san <I> francisco <I> and <O> oakland <B> . <O>
also <B> , <O> the <B> region <I> 's <B> insistence <I> on <B> strict <B> building <I> codes <I> helped <B> prevent <I> wider <B> damage <I> . <O>
the <B> tremendous <I> energy <I> of <B> the <B> quake <I> was <B> dissipated <I> by <B> the <B> distance <I> , <O> so <B> that <I> most <B> parts <I> of <B> the <B> valley <I> and <O> the <B> major <I> cities <I> suffered <B> largely <B> cosmetic <I> damage <I> -- <O> broken <B> windows <I> , <O> falling <B> brick <I> and <I> cornices <I> , <O> buckled <B> asphalt <I> or <I> sidewalks <I> . <O>
of <B> course <B> , <O> the <B> quake <I> was <B> the <B> worst <I> since <B> the <B> emergence <I> of <B> the <B> computer <I> era <I> turned <B> silicon <B> valley <I> into <B> the <B> nation <I> 's <B> capital <I> of <B> high <B> technology <I> . <O>
like <B> other <B> major <I> american <I> cities <I> , <O> the <B> san <I> francisco <I> -- <I> oakland <I> area <I> owes <B> its <B> current <I> prosperity <I> more <B> to <B> its <B> infrastructure <I> of <B> fiber-optic <B> cables <I> linking <B> thousands <B> of <B> computer <B> terminals <I> and <O> telephones <B> than <B> to <B> its <B> location <I> astride <B> one <B> of <B> the <B> world <I> 's <B> great <I> natural <I> harbors <I> . <O>
when <B> the <B> tremors <I> struck <B> , <O> the <B> region <I> 's <B> largely <B> unseen <I> high-tech <B> fabric <I> held <B> up <B> surprisingly <B> well <I> despite <B> the <B> devastation <I> visible <B> from <B> the <B> air <I> . <O>
michael <B> l. <I> bandler <I> , <O> vice <B> president <I> for <B> network <B> technology <I> at <B> pacific <B> bell <I> telephone <I> co. <I> , <O> says <B> nearly <O> all <O> the <B> network <I> 's <B> computer <I> switches <I> , <O> which <B> move <B> thousands <B> of <B> calls <B> a <B> minute <I> from <B> one <B> location <I> to <B> another <B> , <O> changed <B> to <B> battery <B> power <I> when <B> the <B> city <I> lost <B> power <B> . <O>
the <B> battery <I> packs <I> have <B> enough <B> power <I> for <B> only <B> three <I> hours <I> , <O> but <O> that <B> gave <B> emergency <B> crews <I> time <B> to <B> turn <I> on <B> an <B> emergency <I> system <I> that <B> runs <B> primarily <B> on <B> diesel <B> fuel <I> . <O>

`` <O> he <B> does <B> n't <I> signify <I> what <B> people <B> want <B> , <O> so <O> the <B> unrest <I> will <B> go <I> on <B> , <O> '' <O> mr. <B> oldenburg <I> predicts <B> . <O>

two <B> reform-minded <I> party <I> leaders <I> favored <B> by <B> moscow <B> as <B> possible <B> successors <I> to <B> mr. <B> honecker <I> , <O> dresden <B> party <I> secretary <I> hans <I> modrow <I> and <O> politburo <B> member <I> guenter <I> schabowski <I> , <O> were <B> passed <I> over <B> . <O>

the <B> first <I> signs <I> were <B> economic <B> . <O>
